data.name: Magnolia YAML Assistant
data.description:
The plugin significantly reduces the effort of light development in YAML with Magnolia CMS.
Created for developers by developers, it automates the most time-consuming activities during light development:

  • jumping into components, templates, dialogs by reference
  • autocomplete the schema for Magnolia light modules definitions
  • change file references during rename & move

Features

Jump navigation

The plugin supports jump navigation in the following elements of light modules:

  • id-references (e.g. my-module:components/mycomponent-dialog is resolved into my-module/dialogs/components/mycomponent-dialog.yaml)

  • path references (e.g. templateScript: my-module/templates/components/my-template.ftl)

  • i18n key navigation in attributes: title, description, label, buttonLabel, proceedLabel, cancelLabel, confirmationHeader, confirmationMessage, errorMessage, message

  • navigation in !include: and !inherit:

  • class navigation in attributes: class, implementationClass, generatorClass, modelClass, entityClass, appClass, subAppClass, formatterClass, dropConstraintClass, contentPreviewClass

    This feature requires Java Libraries that contain referenced classes in the classpath! Add necessary jars to Libraries in Project Structure.

  • class navigation in $type declarations e.g. $type: textField is linking to info.magnolia.ui.field.TextFieldDefinition

    This feature requires Java Libraries that contain referenced classes in the classpath! Add necessary jars to Libraries in Project Structure.

  • Yaml field dialogId within an action contains a jump link to definition of dialog eg. dialogId: ui-framework-jcr:rename -> ...\info\magnolia\ui\magnolia-ui-framework-jcr\6.2.12\magnolia-ui-framework-jcr-6.2.12.jar!\ui-framework-jcr\dialogs\rename.yaml

Rename & Move refactoring

The plugin supports renaming and moving files referenced by id, dialog or templateScript attributes.
For Move refactoring, please mark the directory that contains the light module as resources root!

Schema autocomplete

Supported versions of magnolia light development syntax are currently 5 and 6. You can set the used version under Preferences > Tools > Magnolia.

data.name: QueryFlag
data.description:
Define and execute template based queries on selected text.

Ever wanted to replace easily a single query parameter from within your editor? Now you can, with QueryFlag plugin.

Just follow those steps:

  1. Go to Preferences -> Tools -> DataBase -> QueryFlag and write your query template.
  2. From within your code, select a word you would like to use as a replacement for your template and right click on it.
  3. Select â€œQuery Flag in DBâ€ and the name of the template to use.
  4. Watch the magic happen

data.name: Nginx Configuration Pro
data.description:
IDE Plugin for Nginx Configuration Files

Professional IDE support for Nginx configuration files with advanced features to enhance your workflow.

Features

  • Code Formatting:
    • Beautiful, consistent code layout with a single keystroke
    • Automatic alignment of values for improved readability
    • Intelligent spacing that makes complex configurations easy to understand
    • Maintains your logical grouping with proper empty line preservation
    • Saves time by eliminating manual formatting work
    • Makes team collaboration easier with consistent code style
  • Support for user-defined directives:
    • Extend Nginx with your custom directives while maintaining IDE support
    • Get auto-completion and documentation for your custom directives
    • Define exactly where your directives can be used for proper validation
    • Share directive configurations with your team for consistent development

    This is the first iteration of the feature. We are actively working on improvements and new capabilities based on user feedback.

  • Advanced inspections and validations:
    • Catch configuration errors before they reach production
    • Get instant feedback on directive usage in wrong contexts
    • Validate complex configurations like geo and map blocks
    • Validate directive parameters for correct usage
    • Reduce debugging time with real-time error detection
  • Comprehensive language support:
    • Enjoy clear, readable code with professional syntax highlighting
    • Write configurations faster with context-aware directive suggestions
    • Navigate complex files easily with the structure overview
    • Document your configurations with proper commenting support
    • Proper recognition of Lua blocks (requires separate Lua plugin for full syntax support)
    • Collapse blocks of code with code folding for better overview of large files
    • Quick documentation for directives to understand their usage
    • Docker envsubst templates support:
      • Recognizes and treats *.conf.template files as Nginx configs
      • Understands ${VARNAME}-style placeholders typically expanded by the official nginx Docker image via envsubst
    • Third-party modules support:
      • Brotli compression
      • MaxMind GeoIP2
      • OpenResty Lua
      • OpenResty Echo

More info

  • meanmail.dev

Other plugins by meanmail

If you like this plugin, check out my other plugins on the JetBrains Marketplace: plugins.jetbrains.com/vendor/meanmail

Your ratings and feedback are very important. The feature will appear the faster the more people request it.

data.name: KS-Explorer
data.description:
Provides support for viewing keystore details.
Core functionality was taken from keystore-explorer.


Important: Next version will have a price 5 USD Individual price or 15 USD Business price per year, to support my work
Features:

  • Supported keystore extensions: jks, jceks, bks, p12, uber, bcfks, pfx
  • Supported certificate extensions: pub, key, pem, cer, crt, p7, p7b, pkipath, spc, p10, spkac, pkcs8, pvk, crl

data.name: API Runner
data.description:
Keywords: dubbo, http, ApiManager, test, grpc

A light tool that enables you to test your HTTP or Dubbo API or GRPC API quickly and easily. For developers to manually validate APIs without additional test code.

Features

  • HTTP/Dubbo Client: Simple way to do HTTP/Dubbo/GRPC requests.
  • Generate Tests In One Click: Automatically generate request from your source code for visual interaction, and easier to use. Supported framework: Dubbo, SpringMVC.
  • Favourite And History Collections: Remember your every request, save any requests for execution at any time.
  • Batch Execution: You can execute all APIs in the collection at once.
  • Rich Configurations: Default values, data mapping, etc.

Quick Start

1. Right-click on one method that your want to test. If you want to run grpc API, right-click on the rpc method in .proto file.

2. Select Request As..., choose Dubbo or HTTP or GRPC request.

3. Change the request info in the ToolWindow if needed.

4. Click the Run button, then you can see the response in the right console.

Others

About Parser

SpringMVC parser only support simple Annotation now: @RequestMapping, @*Mapping, @RequestBody.

The parser's support for complex parameters is not complete enough. Like: Multi-Level nested classes, Unusual Data Types...

Contact me

If you have any questions or ideas, contact me:

github: api-runner

email: cadeeper@gmail.com

data.name: NEON Nette Support
data.description:
NEON (Nette Object Notation; Neon format) is a custom configuration language similar to YAML.

  • Coding assistance (highlighting, completion, formatting, refactorings, etc.)
  • Navigation, search, information about types and implicits
  • Integration with PHP (completion, references, refactorings, etc.)
  • Integration with Nette framework (extension keywords, services, etc.
  • Structure view, typing helpers, etc.

data.name: Mybatis Smart Code Help Pro
data.description:
GitHub|Documentation |qqGroup:777347929

  • Mybatis Smart Code Help Pro is a mybatis auxiliary plug-in
  • You can use this plugin as a database tool without any problems
  • Provide rich mybatis xml file attributes verification, jump, quick repair, automatic completion and other functions
  • The plug-in also comes with a built-in database function, which can execute sql statements, generate mybatis code and other functions
  • Support database addition, deletion, modification and query function
  • The community version has a strong demand for the database can install the Database Tool plugin
  • Contains automatic interception of mybatis sql statements and output in the Mybatis log console window
  • Direct test execution that executes xml statements
  • Contains one-click generation of Dao, Service, and XML basic code
  • Contains some commonly used annotations such as @Data, @Mapper, etc. to cooperate with generation
  • Contains highlighting Dao methods and Xml methods, and can jump back and forth
  • If there are multiple sql statements in the sql file, please separate them with commas. If you do not want to do this and want to execute a certain sql, you can select the sql to be executed that day and execute it
  • Contains some smart reminders
  • Support refactoring of xml parameters, jump
  • Support refactoring of xml if test expression, jump
  • How to use:
    Required prerequisites to generate code:
    You must configure the Database Tools that comes with idea or
    configure the database configuration tool built into the plugin
    Select the table to be generated in Database, right-click to open, and select Mybatis Generator

data.name: XSD / WSDL Visualizer
data.description:
Simplify Your XML Schema Definition (XSD) and WSDL File Editing Process


Licensing update

Starting with September 2025, SchemaViz adopts the perpetual fallback license model:

  • If you purchase or renew an annual license after September 2025, you automatically receive a perpetual license (â€œlifetime licenseâ€) for the current version line (e.g., 2026.0.x).
  • If you stay on a monthly plan for 12 consecutive months after September 2025, you also qualify for a perpetual license for the current version line.
  • This license remains valid even if you cancel your subscription afterwards.

For details on how the fallback license works â€“ and how to check in your JetBrains account whether your subscription has converted into a perpetual license â€“ please see the official documentation: ğŸ‘‰ JetBrains Marketplace: What is a perpetual fallback license?


Attention! Please be aware of a known IntelliJ issue that may occur when updating to version 2026.0 or uninstalling an earlier version of this plugin. Due to a bug in IntelliJ (see bug tracker), XSD file associations may break. If this happens, please follow the instructions in our blog to fix the problem.


Transform the way you work with XSD and WSDL files by using a visual editor that integrates seamlessly into IntelliJ. Say goodbye to the frustration of navigating complex and difficult-to-read code, and hello to a streamlined and intuitive experience.


Key Features:

  • XSD Visualizer: Enhance your understanding of XSD files with an interactive, graphical representation of their structure.
  • WSDL Visualizer: Get a clear and concise view of your WSDL files and quickly identify areas for improvement.
  • Jump to/from source: Effortlessly switch between the visual representation of your code and the underlying source code.

Streamline your workflow and work smarter, not harder, with this powerful tool. Request a free trial today to see the full potential of this solution in action.


You can provide feedback directly inside the 'Design' tab or through the feedback form.



Twitter | YouTube | Reddit | Homepage

data.name: Spring Boot Helper
data.description:
Assist in Spring application development. Adds support for navigation, code inspections, and intelligent autocompletion for Spring configuration files , Spring reference configuration, Spring metadata documentation.(Support: Java, Kotlin, application-*.yaml and bootstrap-*.properties)

Features

Configuration File Assistance

  • Smart Autocompletion: Offers suggestions for both Spring Boot and custom configuration properties. Supports abbreviated (sp.d) and partial (port) matching.

  • Quick Documentation: Displays Javadoc on hover for properties and groups.

  • Go to Definition: Navigates directly to a property's source definition with Ctrl+Click.

Productivity Tools

  • File Conversion: Convert configuration files between YAML (.yml) and Properties (.properties) formats. ğŸ”€

  • Copy Property Keys: Right-click a key to copy it as plain text or an environment variable.

  • Copy as cURL: Right-click a request mapping in a @RestController to copy it as a cURL command.ğŸ§­ (beta).

Spring Initializr

Note: This feature has been moved to its own plugin: Spring Initializr helper

  • Bootstrap new projects or modules using the File / New / Project / Spring Initializr wizard.

Usage

Assuming that you have Spring boot's autoconfiguration jars are present in the classpath, this plugin will automatically allows you to autocomplete properties as suggestions in all your yml files

Suggestions would appear as soon as you type/press Ctrl+Space.

Short form suggestions are also supported such as, sp.d will show you spring.data, spring.datasource, e.t.c as suggestions that make your typing faster

In addition to libraries in the classpath, the plugin also allows you to have your own @ConfigurationProperties available as suggestions in all your yml files.

For this to work, you need to ensure the following steps are followed for your project/module

Configuring the Annotation Processor

data.name: JetLab â€” Integration for GitLab
data.description:
The plugin provides seamless integration with GitLabâ„¢. It supports both GitLab SaaS and GitLab Self-Managed (12.x or later).

GITLAB is a trademark of GitLab Inc. in the United States and other countries and regions. This plugin is not affiliated, endorsed, sponsored, or approved with or by GitLab Inc.

Key Features:
  • Review merge requests directly in your IDE and leave comments
  • Navigate through comments in the diff view
  • Approve merge requests, create new ones, and check out branches
  • Browse comments in a standard editor when the MR branch is checked out
  • Create and browse issues
  • Navigate between issues and merge requests
  • Navigate to merge requests from commits in the Git Log

The plugin acts as a direct client for GitLab and does not send any data to servers other than GitLab.
Passwords and tokens are securely stored on your local machine using the IDE's password storage, which can be configured in the IDE Settings.

data.name: Terminal Pro
data.description:
A user friendly UI for Linux command line.
Makes working in the bash command line easier with IntelliJ UI features like completion, highlighting, etc...
Also, the plugin provides File Manager to navigate the file system and to perform file operations. It's more convenient than "ls", "cd", "cp" commands.

May work as an SSH client because all features are available when you're working on a remote machine through ssh. Also, you can edit remote files in IDE editor like local files, easily download/upload files to a remote machine.

Free Features:

  • Command line completion demo
  • Command history demo
  • Completion command tail from the history (Ctrl+Shift+Space) demo
  • File Manager (Ctrl+O) demo
  • Editing a file on a remote machine in the IntelliJ IDEA editor demo
  • Easy downloading/uploading a file from/to a remote machine when working through SSH demo

In Windows, the plugin works the linux terminal in WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux).

Paid Features

Most features work without a license. Only some minor features require a license.


Support: Issue Tracker, Discussions

data.name: WireMocha
data.description:
WireMocha is an IntelliJ-based plugin that provides integration for the WireMock framework and the ecosystem around it.

It offers various tools to generate and validate WireMock related test code, to provide additional contextual information in the following areas, and to interact with running WireMock servers (the list is not comprehensive):

  • JSON stub mapping files:
    • JSON schemas attached to stub mapping files for code completion and validation
    • Handlebars helpers: validation, code completion, navigation and more
    • Language injections in the JSON and Java DSLs
    • On-the-fly conversion of JSON stub mapping files to the Java DSL
    • Create, split and merge selected mapping objects and mapping files
    • Request-response summary of mapping files in the Project View
  • Java DSL:
    • JUnit 4 and JUnit 5 support
    • Testcontainers support
    • Handlebars and other language injections
  • Extensions:
    • Support for various WireMock extensions like grpc and faker
  • Admin API:
    • WireMock tool window with an Admin API client and a tool for Scenario generation
  • Other features:
    • Various WireMock-specific static code analysis checks
    • Other features for code generation, optimization, navigation and more

OSS attributions

This project derives some built-in documentation and specifications from the WireMock open source project. This content is licensed under the Apache License v2.

This project also uses provider descriptions from the Data Faker open source project. This content is licensed under the Apache License v2.

data.name: DynamoDB
data.description:
DynamoDB Plugin provides integration with local or AWS DynamoDB. It allows to browse and edit tables, run queries, export and import data and more.

Features:

  • Connect to local or AWS DynamoDB
  • Browse data in Table, JSON or DynamoDB JSON view, with paginating and filtering
  • PartiQL queries with autocompletion
  • API operations with autocompletion and documentation
  • Easily scan or query your data with simple expression DSL
  • Save your requests to Favorites or keep them in project files
  • Create, Update or Delete items in table or in JSON editor dialog
  • Export items to CSV, JSON, DynamoDB JSON
  • Copy tables or Import from CSV, JSON, DynamoDB JSON
  • Much more!

Documentation

To get more information about plugin features and usage, please visit the Documentation.

Troubleshooting

Weâ€™d love to get your help in making DynamoDB Plugin better! If you have feedback or encounter any problems, please create a GitHub issue or email us at support@dynamodb-idea.com.

data.name: FastShell
data.description:
Fast Shell supports the management of custom scripts, which can quickly execute shell commands. The supported commands depend on the shell environment used by the current IDE. Fast Shell has a fairly high degree of freedom. All instructions are completely defined by the user.

Replace a very long command with a short command. And it's integrated into the IDE's Run Anything, so you can easily open it with Double Ctrl.

Note: FastShell is a freemium plugin where adding and running custom fs commands is part of paid functionality.


Homepage | Docs/Preview | Bugtracker | Changelog | Community

data.name: XSD to JSON Schema
data.description:
This is a plugin for converting an XML Schema (XSD) file to a JSON Schema file. To perform a conversion, follow these steps:

  1. Once installed, go to Tools -> XML Actions, or right-click on an XSD file from Project view, and select "Convert XSD to JSON Schema". This action displays a dialog box with the same name.
  2. Choose or enter the Input URL of the XSD file you want to convert.
  3. Choose the path of the resulting JSON Schema file.
  4. [Optional] Select the Open in Editor option to open the resulting JSON Schema file in the main editing pane.
  5. For the JSON Schema version option, choose the version of the resulting JSON schema: Draft 4, Draft 6, Draft 7, Draft 2019-09, or Draft 2020-12.
  6. [Optional] If you select the Restrict additional content option, then "additionalProperties" (for objects) and "additionalItems" (for arrays) will be set to false in the resulting schema.
  7. [Optional] You can select the Preserve case of names from the XSD option if you want the names from the XSD to remain unchanged in the resulting JSON Schema.

For another useful tool with multiple conversion types, check JSON-YAML-XML Converter plugin.

data.name: codeCreator
data.description: codeCreator is a general purpose code generator plugin for JetBrains IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio IDEs. It allows for the creation of a code generation task that has one or more sources that can be used in one or more Velocity templates, with each template having its own output. Current outputs are the clipboard, prompted file paths, and templated file paths. One example use would be to create a task that has a Java class source and multiple templates, one for each of a create, read, update, delete, and list page for a Thymeleaf based web app. Each template could have a templated file path, so all the pages could be generated with one task execution.

data.name: JsonToAnyLanguage
data.description:
JsonToAnyLanguage Plugin Introduction

A plugin for converting json strings to any language entity, currently supported languages are:

Javaã€Kotlinã€Dartã€TypeScriptã€OCã€Swiftã€C++ã€Goã€C#ã€Rustã€PHPã€Python

1. Business Background

In daily development, we often use plug-ins to convert JSON to business entities, but at present, there is no plug-in in the plug-in market that can support generating multiple languages at the same time, resulting in the need to download many plug-ins, which is unacceptable for many obsessive-compulsive disorder patients.

Based on this background, I developed this plug-in to integrate these functions into one plug-in.

2. Plug-in download and configuration

Download

You can search for JsonToAnyLanguage directly in the plugin market to download

Plugin configuration

There is no need to configure the plugin by default. Only when the request for the QuickTypeNode service fails, you can build the QuickTypeNode service locally, and then configure the access link into the settings.

3.The use of plug-ins and effects

The plugin is also very simple to use. Just right-click on the directory where you want to generate code to invoke the plugin menu, then paste the Json string in the plugin pop-up window and select the language you want to generate.

4. Feedback

data.name: GitHub Actions Manager
data.description:
This plugin creates a tool-window on JetBrains products (IntelliJ, PyCharm, ...) where you can view GitHub Actions workflow-runs of the repository. This plugin is a good alternative to alt-tabbing for every time you push some changes to the branch and want to see whether the repository's checks are passing on your changes.

You can support the development of the plugin and additional advanced features by [purchasing the plugin on the JetBrains marketplace][marketplace].

Features

Free Features (No license required)

  • View the latest workflow-runs and their statuses.
    • Automatically refreshes every 30 seconds (configurable).
    • Can filter by: workflow-type, user who initiated, branch and event.
    • Can filter by the current-branch, i.e., update workflow-runs when branch changes, and current user.
  • View jobs of a workflow-run and their statuses.
  • View logs of a job, separated by each step result.
  • Configuring settings
    • Use a customized token instead of GitHub settings
    • Frequency of auto-refresh.
    • Customize repositories that should be presented/hidden.

Paid Features (License required)

  • View and download the workflow-run's artifacts.
  • Open pull-request that triggered a workflow-run (in IDE/browser).
  • Approve deployments for workflow-runs that require approval.
  • Trigger a workflow-run for workflows that can be manually dispatched.
    • Ability to provide inputs for workflow ([All GitHub supported input types supported][workflow-inputs]).
  • Rerun/Cancel a workflow-run or a specific job in a workflow-run.
  • Open the workflow file of the workflow-run.
  • Create a link of selected file lines in GitHub

Editing workflow files

  • Highlight outdated actions as warnings
    • Quickfix: update them to the latest version.
  • Highlight unknown actions
  • Navigate to action repository for remote actions
  • Navigate to action file for local actions

data.name: SQL Optimizer,Index Advisor MySQL/Postgre/Oracle, Tune by PawSQL
data.description:
PawSQL Advisor is an automatic and intelligent SQL optimization tool for databases including MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Oracle, MariaDB and etc. It helps database application developers optimize their queries by Clicks.
We also offer PawSQL Cloud, a SaaS-based alternative solution, which provides a free plan for individual users.

Features

  • Rewrite optimization, recommending semantically equivalent, but more efficient SQL.
  • Intelligent index recommendation, based on input SQL syntax, database objects and statistics information.
  • SQL Review, targeting semantic correctness and performance optimization.
  • What-if analysis to ensure gaining better performance after SQL rewriting and indexing recommendations.
  • Index analysis to detect redundant existing indexes.

Databases Supported

  • MySQL 5.6 and above
  • PostgreSQL 9.6 and above
  • Oracle 11g and above(alpha)
  • SQL Server 2008 R2 and above
  • openGauss 2.0 and above
  • MariaDB 10.6 and above(alpha)
  • KingbaseES V8(alpha)

data.name: JSON Browser
data.description:
The IntelliJ JSON Explorer Plugin lets you browse, compare, and edit JSON data in multiple views like JSON view, table view, and tree view. Compare two JSONs, track changes, and securely work offline, ensuring corporate data privacy.

Welcome to the IntelliJ JSON Explorer Plugin, a powerful tool for developers working with JSON files directly within their favorite IDE. This plugin provides a rich, intuitive experience for visualizing, comparing, and editing JSON data, ensuring maximum productivity with minimal effort.

ğŸŒŸ Features

1. Multiple JSON Views

Explore your JSON data in the view that suits your needs:

  • JSON View: A raw, yet structured view for direct manipulation.
  • Table View: View JSON data in a tabular format, allowing easy navigation through key-value pairs.
  • Tree View: A hierarchical view of your JSON, perfect for exploring deeply nested structures.

2. JSON Comparison

Easily compare two JSON files side-by-side to see:

  • Nodes Added: Identifies new elements introduced in the updated JSON.
  • Nodes Removed: Tracks items that have been deleted.
  • Nodes Modified: Highlights changes in values for existing keys.

This feature is especially useful for version control, code reviews, or verifying the integrity of your data.

3. Interactive Table Editing

  • Double-click Editing: In the Table View, you can double-click on any cell to open a detailed view of the JSON element in a subpanel. From there, you can choose different view modes to further inspect or edit the JSON.
  • Nested JSON Support: Seamlessly explore and edit deeply nested JSON elements within the table view.

4. Offline Functionality

Designed with corporate users in mind, the plugin works entirely offline. This means:

  • No Internet Connection Required: All JSON operations (viewing, comparing, editing) happen locally on your machine.
  • Data Privacy and Security: Since no data is sent over the internet, it is ideal for environments where data privacy is paramount.

ğŸ›¡ï¸ Corporate Use Case

This plugin was built with corporate environments in mind, where data privacy is crucial. Since it operates entirely offline:

  • You donâ€™t need to worry about sensitive data being uploaded or shared with online services.
  • All processing happens locally, making it a safe choice for companies with strict data protection policies.

ğŸ’¡ Feedback/Suggestion

Please feel free to provide constructive feedback and feature requests by creating a new issue on https://github.com/geetesh-gupta/JSON-Browser/issues.

data.name: Connect Api
data.description:
Connect API ToolWindow for Kafka Connect

Description

A GUI/ToolWindow for interacting with Kafka Connect over its REST API. Allows for inspecting, monitoring, and interacting with running connectors, as well as deploying new connectors.

Features

  • Connect to multiple Kafka Connect clusters.
  • Inspect running connectors and their tasks.

  • Restart, Pause, and Resume running/failed connectors and their tasks.
  • Validate and Deploy new connectors to a cluster.
    • Ability to store "templates" for connectors to ease setup and deployment.

Getting Help

data.name: JSON-YAML-XML Converter
data.description:
This is a plugin for converting JSON, YAML and XML files. To perform a conversion, follow these steps:

  1. Once installed, go to Tools, or right-click on a JSON, YAML, or XML file from Project view, and select "Convert Between JSON, YAML and XML". This action displays a dialog box with the same name.
  2. Choose the conversion type (4 options available).
  3. Choose or enter the Input URL of the file you want to convert.
  4. Choose the path of the resulting Output file.
  5. Select the Open in Editor option to open the resulting document in the main editing pane.
  6. (Only for XML to JSON) Select how you want empty elements to be converted (default is object).

data.name: Build Monitor
data.description:
Build Monitor

Description

Monitor Github Action Workflows and Buildkite Builds from within your IDE.
Setup profiles which automatically refresh the status of your builds alerting you when they complete or fail. Easily and quickly retry failed builds with one click.

Cost

The free to use version of the plugin has 100% of the functionality of the paid version, however it is limited by the number of remote accounts you can configure to one. Additional limit on creating up to two "build monitor profiles."

Features

Free

  • Connect to Buildkite to monitor Builds.
  • Connect to Github to monitor Workflow actions.
  • Configurable automatic retry of failed jobs on monitored builds.
  • Configurable notifications (poups and sounds) based on the status of monitored builds.
  • Configurable fields to be displayed inline with your monitored builds.
  • Configurable filter criteria to limit exactly which builds are monitored.

Paid

  • Unlimited Accounts.
  • Unlimited Monitor Profiles.

Usage

Adding Buildkite Account

Create a new Buildkite API Access Token: https://buildkite.com/user/api-access-tokens.

Using your Buildkite account, create a new API access token with the following permissions:

  • GraphQL API To retrieve users, builds, jobs, and pipelines.
  • Read Pipelines To list and retrieve details of pipeslines.
  • Read Builds To list and retrieve details of builds.
  • Modify Builds To create new, retry failed, and cancel running builds.
  • Read User To retrieve basic details about users.
  • Read Organizations Used to list and retrieve details of builds.

Add account to Project Settings for Plugin.

Settings/Preferences > Tools > Build Monitor Accounts

  1. Click the + icon and give your new account a name.
  2. Select BUILDKITE from the Type field.
  3. Paste your API Access Token into to the Api Access Token field.
  4. Click the Test Connection button to verify everything works.

Skip to instructions below labeled Setup Build Monitor Profile

Adding Github Account

Create a new Personal Access Token: https://github.com/settings/tokens.

Using your Github account, create a new Personal Access Token (classic) with the following permissions:

  • Repository
    • READ Required to read Workflow Actions.
  • Workflow
    • READ To list and retrieve details of workflows and workflow actions.
    • WRITE To Rerun, retry, and cancel workflows.

Settings/Preferences > Tools > Build Monitor Accounts

  1. Click the + icon and give your new account a name.
  2. Select GITHUB from the Type field.
  3. Paste your Personal Access Token into to the Api Access Token field.
  4. Click the Test Connection button to verify everything works.

Skip to instructions below labeled Setup Build Monitor Profile

Setup Build Monitor Profile

Build Monitor Profiles allow you to define which builds/workflows you want to show up in the ToolWindow. You can define multiple profiles, each with varying filter criteria. Additionally, you can alter which pieces of information are displayed inline along side the build.

Settings/Preferences > Tools > Build Monitor Accounts > Monitor Profiles

  1. Click the + icon and give your new profile a name.
  2. Select which Account you want to use.
  3. Define the filter criteria to determine which builds will be displayed.
  4. Display Options allows you to select which pieces of information will be included with the build.
  5. Notification Options allows you select which types of notifications you would like to receive for the builds.

Launch Monitor

From the Tools drop down menu select Build Monitor to open the ToolWindow.

Select a Build Monitor Profile to open the display.

Bug Reports and Feature Requests

Submit BugReports or Feature Requests: https://github.com/SourceLabOrg/BuildMonitor_IntellijPlugin/issues

data.name: JetClient - The Ultimate REST Client
data.description:
JetClient is a REST (HTTP) client and API testing tool. It provides everything you need to design, test, and debug APIs effectively.

Important Notice
From 1 August 2025, JetClient will require a paid licence. A 14-day free trial will be available. Licence revenue will support continued development and new features. Read more about this change.

With Git sync, it enables effortless collaboration and version management for your team. Key features include:

  • File Sync (Git Sync): Stores requests and folders in a human-readable format on your file system, enabling easy sharing and collaboration with your team via Git.
  • Environment Groups: Create environment groups to select multiple environments at once. For example, one group for (dev, test, prod) and another for (user, admin).
  • Convenient Variable Management: Variables are defined in JSON5 format and organized into two editors: shared (synced) and local (non-synced). Variables can include not only primitive types but also objects and arrays.
  • Powerful Scripting: Write pre-request and test scripts for requests and folders. Additionally, create test suite scripts that can reuse existing requests, eliminating the need to duplicate them.
  • Enhanced Inline Expressions: Use {{...}} syntax to include variables, function calls, arithmetic operations, string concatenation, and more directly in your requests and scripts. Includes built-in functions for random data generation, user prompts, reading files, JavaScript code evaluation, running shell commands, and more.
  • Integration with Source Code and OpenAPI: Import APIs directly from your source code, and effortlessly navigate between requests and the corresponding code, and vice versa.
  • GraphQL Support: Integrates seamlessly with JetBrains' GraphQL plugin for syntax highlighting and code completion.


Most features are free, including File Sync (Git Sync), Environments, Variables, Scripting, etc. However, some features are available only in the paid version:

  • API Import: Import collections of requests from the source code.

  • Code Navigation: Navigate to the source code of the endpoint from the request editor and vice versa.

  • Advanced Inline Expression Functions: Use powerful built-in functions like $eval(jsCode) to execute JavaScript, $exec(command) to run shell commands, $readFileAsText(filePath) to read file contents, and $readFileAsBase64(filePath) to read files as Base64 strings, and user input functions like $textInput to collect data dynamically during execution.
    Supported imports:

  • OpenAPI (Swagger)

  • cURL

  • Postman

  • Spring

  • JAX-RS

  • Retrofit


Explore the capabilities of JetClient with the JetClient Demo Project.
Learn more in the JetClient Documentation.

data.name: AI Coding
data.description:
AI Coding can help developers use the services of AI providers (such as OpenAI/Claude/Baidu/Google) more conveniently, improving development efficiency.

  • Features
    • Supports MCP (Model Context Protocol), allowing developers to define custom tools and extend AI interaction capabilities to meet specific workflow needs.
    • Add a chat function in the upper right corner of the editor, making it easy to communicate with AI.
    • During coding, AI provides intelligent autocomplete suggestions based on code context, enhancing programming efficiency and accuracy.
    • Submitting the git diff content to an AI provider (such as OpenAI/Claude/Baidu/Google) and automatically generates a Git commit message.
    • Rename a Java/PHP/Python/Kotlin declaration, the AI will suggest name options for the declaration, based on its contents.
    • Add AI error explanation when Java/PHP/Python code fails to run. Helps quickly locate and resolve issues.
    • Add AI documentation generation functionality for Java, Kotlin, Python, and PHP, enhancing development efficiency and code readability.
    • Provide a custom AI vendor service address and request parameters to allow developers to use relevant services more flexibly.
    • Support HTTP Proxy

data.name: AICommit

AI-powered programming assistant for JetBrains IDEs!

Upgrade your coding workflow with AICommit â€“ your all-in-one AI programming assistant!

data.name: CodeMate
data.description:
Welcome to CodeMate! Here, you can utilize the ApiKey registered on the OpenAI official website to write code and receive suggestions and examples about Coding.
Please note that we do not provide services for registering OpenAI accounts. Our service is aimed at users who already have a usable ApiKey. Please download and install cautiously.
In addition, one of the key features of this plugin is the AI Agent Mode. This mode enables the AI to autonomously perceive, make decisions, and execute tasks based on a given goal. If the result is unsatisfactory, any step can be re-executed.
We support the latest version of OpenAI official API: /v1/chat/completions, and offer models such as gpt-3.5-turbo, gpt-4, gpt-4-turboã€GPT-4oã€GPT-4o-mini for your selection.
Helpful tips:
1. To optimize or explain code, select the code, right-click "CodeMate" menu, and choose the submenu.
2. After writing comments, press Enter, right-click "CodeMate" menu, and select "Generate Method" to automatically generate code.
3. If you encounter timeouts or unstable network prompts, check if you have set up an HTTP proxy at Preferences-> Tools-> CodeMate.
Here are the steps to use:
1. Search and install the plugin named CodeMate.
2. In plugin settings, configure your ApiKey: Preferences-> Tools-> CodeMate.
3. Enjoy the convenience brought by CodeMate!
Below is an example of using this plugin: ã€6-minute Snake game creationã€‘.
The file is large, click here to watch.
Enter the homepage
If you have any questions, please submit an issue.

data.name: OWASP IDE-VulScanner
data.description:
OWASP IDE-VulScanner is an open source IDE plugin tool to analyze an applicationâ€™s components. It is built on top of OWASP Dependency Check, which scans your application's component vulnerabilities during implementation phase.

Features

  • Analyse your project dependencies CVSS score
  • Scan support for Java, .Net, Python, Ruby, PHP (composer), NodeJS, C, C++
  • Highlights vulnerable components within your project
  • Generate OWASP Dependency Check Report

data.name: PolyBPMN visualizer
data.description:
PolyBPMN plugin for IntelliJ IDEA is a visualiser for BPMN diagrams with navigation and process debugging support. It supports editing and visualising BPMN diagrams created in such modellers as Activiti, Camunda, and Flowable.



We are waiting for your feedback, found issues, new proposals to improve the plugin, so that it becomes better and fits all your needs.

Key features:

  1. Create and edit BPMN XML files.
  2. IntelliJ IDEA tips (class, expression, delegate expression).
  3. Jump from modeller element to XML element.
  4. Smoothly change the shape of diagrams.
  5. Multi-dialect support (Camunda, Flowable, Activiti).
  6. Comparison of BPMN files with previous versions (works with Git).
  7. Embedded diagram window with controls inside XML file editor.
  8. Support for three editing modes: BPMN file, BPMN modeller, and split view.

Shortcuts:

  • Ctrl/Cmd and Y: Redo
  • Ctrl/Cmd and Z: Undo
  • Ctrl/Cmd and C: Copy
  • Ctrl/Cmd and X: Cut
  • Ctrl/Cmd and V: Paste
  • Shift and N: Open a context menu
  • Ctrl/Cmd and +: Zoom in
  • Ctrl/Cmd and -: Zoom out
  • Delete or Backspace: Delete selected element
  • Arrow keys: Move the canvas
  • Hold shift key plus left click mouse to move round canvas
  • Ctrl and scrolling mouse or touchpad: Change layer in match mode

data.name: Onegai Copilot
data.description:
Onegai Copilot

Onegai Copilot is the ultimate coding companion, powered by cutting-edge AI technology. Say goodbye to tedious coding errors and hello to a seamless coding experience. With the OpenAI API at its core, Onegai Copilot offers a range of features to supercharge your coding workflow.Experience the future of coding with Onegai Copilot â€“ your indispensable coding partner. Let's code smarter, faster, and error-free together!

Features comparison

FeatureFreeFreemiumSupported languagesProviders
Chat modeâœ…âœ…allOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama
Custom modeâœ…âœ…kotlin, javaOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama
Code refactor - Renameâœ…âœ…kotlin, javaOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama
Code CompletionâŒâœ…allOpenAI only for now
Document generationâŒâœ…kotlin, javaOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama
Git commit generationâŒâœ…allOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama
Add Context reference filesâŒâœ…allOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama
More advanced featuresâŒâœ…kotlin, javaOpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama

Key Features:

  • Chat Mode: Engage in a conversation with the AI to receive instant code assistance.
  • Completion Mode: Receive intelligent code completions tailored to your specific needs.
    • Generate Unit Tests: Easily create unit tests from natural language descriptions.
  • Code Generation: Effortlessly generate implementation code from plain language descriptions.
  • Conversational Support: Enjoy fluid communication with the AI for a more intuitive experience.
  • API Integration: Seamlessly integrate with OpenAI, Anthropic, Ollama, and other OpenAI-compatible APIs.
  • Custom Project Prompts: Define prompt folders to streamline project setup and execution.
    • Default folder under the project root: prompts Example: project-root/prompts/example.yaml
        ---
  name: "Code refactoring - chat mode"
  intention: "chat"
  prompt: |
  You are an experienced software development engineer, you need refactor the given code #{language} language:
  #{selection}
  And you also need to add documentation to the code.
  ---
  name: "Code refactoring - replace selection mode"
  intention: "replaceSelection"
  prompt: |
  As an experienced software development engineer, you are tasked with refactoring the provided code selection in the #{language} language:
  #{selection}
  Additionally, you are required to provide documentation for the code without using wrap symbols like ```.
  ---
  name: "Code completion - insert after caret mode"
  intention: "insertAfterCaret"
  prompt: |
  You are an experienced software development engineer, you need to complete the given code #{language} language:
  #{selection}

And more features, languages, and providers are coming soon!

Enterprise Customization and Support - contact us for more information

Getting started

To use onegai copilot, you will need to have an API key for the ChatGPT API. You can sign up for an API key on the ChatGPT website.

Once you have an API key, you can install the plugin from the IntelliJ IDEA plugin marketplace.

data.name: Verilog Language Support
data.description:
Adds support for Verilog (IEEE 1364-2005) language. The following features are available with IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition:
  • Syntax highlighting
  • Find definition and usages
  • Keywords completion
  • Structure view
  • File templates
  • Error annotation
  • Preprocessing (include/conditional/macro)
  • File formatting

Getting started

IntelliJ IDEA is an IDE famous for its ergonomics and intelligent coding assistance it provides for developers coding in Java, JavaScript and other languages. This plugin extends IntelliJ IDEAâ€™s toolset with support for Verilog (IEEE 1364-2005).

Notes:

  • Please be noted that this plugin was intended to be a paid plugin.
  • include directive supports absolute and relative header file path. If the header file path is a relative path, it is searched in the following order:
    1. directory of the current source file
    2. project root directory
    3. INCLUDE_PATH environment variable value configured in the current selected Verilog RunConfiguration, which should be absolute paths separated with "::".

data.name: NoSQL Navigator
data.description:
NoSQL Navigator for MongoDB is an advanced plugin for JetBrains IDEs. The plugin allows to perform basic and advanced operations with MongoDB directly from your IDE.

About this version:

This is an early version with a low price. In one of the future updates the price will be increased. We would be grateful if you support further development with a purchase.

Features:

  • support of MongoDB 3.2+
  • support SSH tunnels
  • support SCRAM-SHA-1, SCRAM-SHA-256, MongoDB AWS auth types
  • support of external MongoDB Tools and MongoDB Shell
  • support to show data in 3 views: tree, table and JSON
  • convenient process monitoring
  • CRUD-operations
  • full management of databases, collections, indexes, users and roles
  • import/export data via mongodump/mongorestore
  • possibility to fill the database with test data
  • support to split connections into groups
  • sql query to MongoDB query converter (beta)
  • hints when editing MongoDB query
  • query history
  • templates
  • GridFS support
  • views support
  • full SSL support
  • Advanced Collection And Index Managers
  • CSV Import/Export
  • copy/paste docs/collections/indexes

Planned Features:

  • Test Data Generator
  • Export/Import to SQL Databases and different formats
  • Map-Reduce support
  • tasks scheduler
  • reports generator
  • query builder
  • schema analyzer
  • MongoDB learning mode
  • and much more...

Feedback

If you find a bug or have any ideas how to improve the plugin - let us know by email or add an issue to our public GitHub repository.

data.name: GPT Assistant
data.description:
Supercharge Your JetBrains Rider with GPT Assistant

Transform your development workflow with the GPT Assistant Plugin for JetBrains Rider. Leveraging the power of OpenAI's and Azure OpenAI's advanced GPT models, GPT Assistant integrates seamlessly into your IDE, offering intelligent, context-aware coding suggestions tailored to your current codebase.

Key Benefits:

  • Enhanced Productivity: Save time on repetitive coding tasks and quickly find solutions to complex problems without leaving your development environment.
  • Contextual Understanding: Unlike other assistants that use only the current file as context, GPT Assistant semantically selects the relevant context from your entire solution, providing precise and relevant suggestions.
  • Flexible Integration: Works with both OpenAI and Azure OpenAI deployments, supporting API-key or Entra-ID authentication for added security in enterprise environments.

Note: To use GPT Assistant, an OpenAI API-key or an Azure deployment with either API-key or Entra-ID authentication is required. This ensures you maintain full control over your data, with support for both standard OpenAI and Azure OpenAI deployments.

Getting Started:

  • Easy Setup: Detailed instructions on setting up your API key and configuring the plugin can be found here.

Security and Privacy:

Your code is transmitted to OpenAI or Azure OpenAI for context processing. As of the time of writing, neither OpenAI nor Azure OpenAI use API-transmitted data to train or improve their models. Learn more about their data usage policies here and here.

Why Choose GPT Assistant?

  • Cost-Effective: Enjoy advanced AI assistance at a fraction of the cost of other solutions, with only the minimal plugin cost and your own API usage fees. This combined cost is typically much lower than other assistant solutions.
  • Advanced Contextualization: Benefit from a plugin that semantically understands and selects the most relevant context from your entire solution, offering superior code suggestions.

Enhance your Rider experience with GPT Assistant today and take your coding to the next level!

While GPT Assistant is a highly innovative tool, it's recommended to always review and test the AI-generated code for accuracy and appropriateness within your specific context. Start enhancing your Rider experience with GPT Assistant today!

Please also note that the quality of the answers is determined by the language model, not this plugin.

data.name: JMeter Viewer
data.description:
Provides support to view jmeter test plans.

Features:
  • JMeter test plan Viewer
  • Download JMeter

data.name: Swift Support
data.description:
Cross-platform Swift language support for JetBrains IDEs 2024.3 and later.


discussions Â· bug tracker Â· newsletter

This plugin is under active development and in an early state!
It's cross-platform and available for all JetBrains 2024.3 IDEs and later.

Important: This plugin is a freemium plugin. For now, all features are free to use. Support the development by purchasing a license for USD 1 per month.

At this time, all features are free to use until the plugin is more stable. Swift Support is a freemium plugin. If you'd like to support its development, you can purchase a license for a symbolic USD 1.0 per month. Please note that the final price will be higher when the product is stable.

Join the Swift plugin newsletter to receive updates about the plugin and its development.

Please join the discussions to shape the future of this plugin.

Available features (most in an early state):

  • Support for the language specification of Swift 6.2
  • Native code formatter.
  • Code completion
  • Find usages, go to declaration, rename refactoring
  • Code error highlighting with quick fixes
  • Inlay hints for types and parameters
  • Structure view
  • Type hierarchy (supertypes, subtypes, or both in a single hierarchy)
  • Call hierarchy (callees (outgoing calls), callers (incoming calls))
  • Support for "Go to class" and "Go to symbol"
  • Quick documentation with colored rendering of embedded code blocks
  • Code folding with custom settings for default code folding
  • Language injection support for string and multiline string literals
  • File templates for common Swift declarations
  • Syntax highlighting, including semantic token highlighting
  • Color schema settings
  • ToDo item highlighting
  • Navigation bar support
  • Brace matching for (), {}, []
  • Comment support

Most of the features rely on Apple's sourcekit-lsp and need an installed Swift toolchain. The implementation was tested with the current stable version of Swift.



Known limitations of the already available features:

  • swift build must be executed for up-to-date results of code insights (find usages, rename, ...). Without swift build some features, e.g. go to definition, don't work.
  • Renaming a function declared in a protocol does not yet rename all implementations of this function.

data.name: Azure Coding
data.description:
Welcome to Azure Coding! Here, you can use Azure OpenAI to write code, interpret code, optimize code, and do some questions and answers yourself.
This plugin by Microsoft Azure official OpenAI service function, website address: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/openai/
You can manage information such as Endpoint, DeploymentName, ApiVersion, and ApiKey, and plug-ins use this configuration to use OpenAI's capabilities.
It should be noted that we do not provide the service of registering Azure OpenAI account, our service is for users who already have an available Azure OpenAI account, please download and install with caution.

Some friendly reminders:
1. Where you want to generate code, write a code comment that describes in natural language what you want to do.
2. Invoke the generated Code menu item below the comment, such as "Generate Code".
3. Select a menu item and press enter to generate the code automatically.
4. Check whether the generated code meets your needs, if not satisfied, you can delete the previously generated code, arouse the menu again, repeat the second step.
Here are the steps to use Azure Coding:
1. Search and install the Azure Coding plugin.
2. In plug-in Settings, configure your account information: Preferences-> Tools-> Azure Coding.
3. Enjoy the convenience that Azure Coding brings!
Due to account issues, we are unable to continue testing and this plugin will no longer receive updates. We apologize for any inconvenience caused.ï¼

data.name: GitLab CICD - Pipelines & Jobs, Builds Run Cancel Retry View Log
data.description:
GitLab CICD for software developers

GitLab CICD is an IDE plugin designed to make it easier for you to view and manage GitLab CI/CD directly from within the IDE. The plugin provides a user-friendly interface that allows you to easily view, run, cancel and retry GitLab Pipelines and Jobs without having to switch between the IDE and the GitLab web interface.

It works with both GitLab SaaS and GitLab Self-Managed (15.x or later).


With GitLab CICD, you can:

  • ğŸ” Quickly view the status of pipelines.
  • ğŸ–¥ View detailed information about each pipeline, stage and job.
  • ğŸ›  Run, cancel and retry pipeline or job.
  • ğŸ“‹ Display job log in real time.
  • ğŸ’¾ Download job artifacts.
  • ğŸ”” Receive notifications when your pipelines have been started or finished.
  • âœ… Validate/Lint your CICD configuration files (e.g. .gitlab-ci.yml).
  • ğŸŒ™ Enjoy GitLab CI/CD in Dark Mode.

â—Important note: The plugin acts as a direct client for GitLab, ensuring that no data is transmitted to any server other than GitLab itself. Access tokens are stored securely on your local machine in the IDE's password storage, which you can configure in the IDE Settings.


To open plugin, click on View -> Tool Windows -> GitLab CICD.

To validate CICD file, right-click on file, then select Validate CICD file.


By using GitLab CICD, you can save time and streamline your development workflows by eliminating the need to switch between multiple applications and interfaces. The plugin is easy to install and use, and provides a seamless integration between IDE and GitLab CI CD.

Plugin supports Chinese (Simplified) language pack.

data.name: LocalStack Toolkit
data.description:
LocalStack Toolkit is designed to streamline the process of managing and integrating your local AWS environment, via LocalStack, directly into your IntelliJ IDE.

Currently, the LocalStack Toolkit offers comprehensive support for AWS Simple Queue Service (SQS), AWS Simple Storage Service (S3), and partial support for AWS Lambda and SNS. With its user-friendly interface, users can seamlessly access various functionalities within the comfort of their IntelliJ environment. Additionally, itâ€™s possible to configure the LocalStack URL address, region, access, and secret keys.

Features

SQS (Simple Queue Service)

  • Create SQS queue (Standard, FIFO, Advanced)
  • Get a list of queues
  • View queue attributes
  • Send messages to a queue
  • Receive messages from a queue, including Recording mode
  • Beautify received messages (JSON)
  • Copy received messages
  • Purge queue
  • Delete queue

S3 (Simple Storage Service)

  • Create S3 bucket (Simple)
  • Get a list of S3 buckets
  • Delete S3 buckets
  • Create folders in S3 buckets
  • Navigate through S3 bucket folders
  • Upload objects and folders to S3 buckets
  • Upload objects and folders to S3 buckets from Project View pop-up
  • View objects in S3 buckets
  • Delete objects from S3 buckets

SNS (Simple Notification Service)

  • Create SNS topic (Simple)
  • View SNS topic attributes
  • Delete SNS topic

Lambda

  • Create Lambda function
  • Invoke Lambda function
  • Delete Lambda function

Plugin-related features

  • Change LocalStack URL (Configuration)
  • Change LocalStack Access Key and Secret Key (Configuration)
  • Change Timeout (Configuration)
  • Change LocalStack Region (Configuration and Bar Widget)
  • Dynamic Configuration Reload
  • Template management

data.name: Sentry
data.description:
The Sentry plugin allows you to browse issues, events, and stacktraces right in your IDE.

Free Features:

  • Browse issues and events
  • View stacktraces and navigate to the source code
  • Filter issues and sort them as you would in Sentry

Premium Features (requires a license):

  • Open multiple tabs with issues
  • Assign issues to yourself or to other users
  • Resolve, ignore, or bookmark issues

Experience the ease of managing Sentry issues without ever leaving your IDE.

data.name: JetBrains AI Assistant
data.description:
JetBrains AI Assistant seamlessly integrates with your IDE to help you code faster, smarter, and with less effort.


AI Assistant offers intelligent code completion, explains and generates code, writes documentation, suggests commit messages, and answers questions through an AI-powered, context-aware chat.


You can choose from top-tier cloud-based LLMs or connect your own local models, giving you the flexibility and control to work your way.



AI Assistant is part of the JetBrains AI subscription and includes a free tier available in all JetBrains IDEs.

Learn more about the pricing plans


Whatâ€™s included:

  • Unlimited code completion powered by Mellum, JetBrainsâ€™ proprietary AI model.
  • Context-aware AI chat that understands your code and helps you in real time.
  • Access to top-tier models from OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google.
  • Offline mode with connected local LLMs via Ollama or LM Studio.
  • Deep integration into IDE workflows, including code suggestions in the editor, VCS assistance, runtime error explanation, and more.

Learn more about the features


Code security and privacy

  • Not used for training: Your code and data are never used to train AI models.
  • Zero data retention: Data processed through JetBrains AI is not persisted by JetBrains or any third-party providers.
  • Full control and flexibility: Exclude specific files or projects from the AI context or switch to offline mode â€“ you decide how and when AI is used.

We value your feedback

You can upvote existing issues in our YouTrack or log in and create a new one. Or just contact support for further assistance.



Unlock your full coding potential with AI Assistant â€” making your workflow smarter, faster, and more enjoyable every step of the way.

data.name: Kafka Client
data.description:
A powerful client for Apache Kafka. It provides support for multiple clusters, allowing you to efficiently manage topics, publish and consume messages, and perform various Kafka-related operations right within IntelliJ.

Multiple clusters support:

  • Easily manage different Kafka clusters through the plugin.

Topics Management:

  • Create, delete, and modify topic partitions with ease.
  • Display system topics.
  • Search topics using regular expressions.

Message Consumption:

  • Consume messages using different strategies.
  • Wait for messages within the specified poll time.
  • Read the latest messages from a topic.
  • Read messages from a specific partition with a specific offset.

Message Publishing:

  • Publish String/Byte serialized messages.
  • Integration with Schema Registry for serialization into JSON, AVRO, and Protobuf.

Bulk Message Generation:

  • Generate a large volume of messages quickly using a defined template.

Additional Operations:

  • Copy topic messages into another topic/clusterConfig.
  • Delete messages from a topic.
  • Search for specific patterns in the key or value of the topic.

data.name: Source Synchronizer Pro
data.description:
A fast, one-way file synchronization tool for your projects.

Sourcesync Pro's synchronization, forwarding and comparison capabilities for local vs remote files provide a fast and seamless way of transferring code, binary artifacts and configuration files between local and remote development environments.

Local VCS changes, files and directories can be transferred on the remote infrastructure using the SCP or SSH protocols. Other notable features include:

  • password and key pair authentication
  • support for key pairs with and without passphrases
  • timestamp preserving
  • file filtering
  • user-friendly UI with support for IntelliJ's New UI feature
  • synchronization of single or multi-selection files as well as VCS changes

data.name: Azd
data.description:
Azure DevOps pull requests integration.

Based on Jetbrains GitHub/GitLab plugins, AZD will streamline your development with Azure DevOps.

AZD plugin integrates with both Azure DevOps Service and Azure DevOps Server (versions: 2020 or 2022).

Connect to your Azure DevOps account with a PAT and bring Azure DevOps features directly into your IDE.

Features

  • ğŸš€Active Pull Requests: Get an overview of all your active pull requests.
  • ğŸš€Superior Code Review: Review code using your IDE's advanced syntax highlighting and code insight features.
  • ğŸš€Manage Pull Requests: Seamlessly create, approve, or reject pull requests without switching context.
  • ğŸš€Collaboration Tools: Engage in discussions, leave comments, and collaborate with your team.
  • ğŸš€Pipelines Tools: Run and monitor pipelines directly from your IDE.
  • ğŸš€Pipelines Tests: Get a detailed overview of your pipeline tests and analyze test results, logs, and stack traces.
  • ğŸš€Pipelines YAML: Get code completion and validation for Azure DevOps Pipelines YAML schema.
  • ğŸš€AI-Powered PR Titles: Generate meaningful pull request titles automatically based on your changes.
  • ğŸš€AI-Generated PR Descriptions: Create comprehensive pull request descriptions with a single click.
  • ğŸš€AI Code Review: Review pull requests with AI chat assistance to identify issues and improvements.
  • ğŸš€Smart Commit Messages: Generate contextual commit messages that accurately describe your code changes.

License

This project is licensed under the MIT License. See the LICENSE file for details.
