data.name: Polaris Tomcat Server
data.description:
Polaris Tomcat Server is a plugin for Intellij IDEA Community, Ultimate and Educational.

Highlights:

  • One-click to download tomcat
  • Auto-detect maven web projects
  • Auto-detect gradle web projects
  • Auto build artifacts before launch tomcat
  • Support launch multiple artifacts
  • Support external war files and exploded war directories

The Polaris Tomcat Server supports Tomcat 7 and above.

data.name: DataGraph
data.description:
The DataGraph plugin visualizes JSON, YAML, and XML in interactive graphs, providing a powerful tool for exploring large and complex data structures.

Here's what you can do with DataGraph:

  • Explore and interact with data in a graph view, supporting JSON, YAML, XML, TOML, and Properties files
  • Seamlessly navigate between the graph and the corresponding location in the editor, and vice versa
  • Collapse and expand nodes in the graph, with synced functionality in the editor
  • Export the graph to a PNG or SVG file

For files of a smaller size, the plugin is entirely FREE to use. To explore larger files, a license purchase is required.

Inspired by the JsonCrack tool, DataGraph offers additional advantages, including tight integration with the editor and the ability to work locally without sending data to a server, making it safe to use with sensitive data.

data.name: JSON Schema Generator
data.description:
This is a plugin for generating a sample JSON Schema from a JSON file. To generate a sample JSON Schema file, follow these steps:

  1. Once installed, go to Tools -> JSON Actions, or right-click on an JSON file from Project view, and select "Generate JSON Schema...". This action displays a dialog box called "JSON Schema Generator".
  2. Choose or enter the Input URL of the JSON file.
  3. Choose the path of the resulting JSON Schema file.
  4. [Optional] Select the Open in Editor option to open the resulting JSON Schema file in the main editing pane.
  5. For the JSON Schema version option, choose the version of the resulting JSON schema: Draft 4, Draft 6, Draft 7, Draft 2019-09, or Draft 2020-12.
  6. [Optional] If you select the Extract matching format for strings option, the generator will attempt to find a format that matches the string values from the JSON Document.
  7. [Optional] You can select the Restrict additional content option if you want additional / unevaluated properties / items to be set to false in the resulting schema.
  8. [Optional] Select the Add default values for simple types option and the default values (0 for number, "" for string, false for boolean) and examples for strings will be added.
  9. [Optional] If you select the Make all properties required option, the generator will mark all the properties as required in the resulting schema.

data.name: TamaCat Web Browser
data.description:
A Full-Featured web browser with the following free features:

  • Embedded Browser: Browse any website directly in the IDE with a fully functional embedded browser.
  • Tabbed Browsing: Switch between multiple websites using tabs.
  • DevTools Integration: Utilize DevTools for web page debugging and diagnostics.
  • Formatted Source View: Automatically format and display the page source for better readability.

Extra capabilities to supercharge your development workflow (Premium features for paid users):

  • Multiple Tool Windows: Open multiple tool windows to view several websites simultaneously.
  • Tab Pinning: Pin tabs to retain the same websites across IDE restarts.
  • Flexible Browser Placement: Place the embedded full-featured browser in tool windows or editor tabs as needed.
  • Host-Based Address Bar Coloring: Assign different background colors to the browser's address bar based on the host. This feature helps users visually distinguish between environments, reducing the risk of environment mix-ups.
  • JavaScript Error Notification: Detect JavaScript errors on the loaded webpage and display notifications in the tool window. Allow one-click access to DevTools for error debugging.
  • Port Detection: Automatically detect application ports and provide one-click access to open them in the browser.
  • Auto-Reload on Port Open: Automatically reload pages that failed to load before the application started.
  • IDE Link Integration: Open files or specific lines directly in the IDE editor from GitHub, GitLab, or Backlog links.

data.name: SSH Tool
data.description:
SSH allows you to connect directly to remote services without leaving the development function, and continue to log in, file upload, copy and other convenient operations.

contents

1. SSH password login connection
2. SSH keypair connection
3. SSH openssh config connection

How to use:

Tools -- select 'Connection to SSH'

data.name: Retrofit Assistant
data.description:
Retrofit Assistant lets you use Retrofit more efficiently, safely, and in line with best practices. With it you can:

Feature introduction

  • Summarize all the retrofit interfaces in the project into a tool window, the experience is similar to the Structure tool window, showing all the interfaces in a tree form, you can enter path keywords in the window to filter the interfaces, double-click or press enter for quick navigation.

  • It provides a large number of local code checks and quick corrections, such as common missing annotations, incorrect parameter types, nullable types used in non-nullable parameters, and illegal characters in the header. Basically, unless it's intentional, it's hard to write an interface that doesn't make requests properly.

  • You can use a dialog to create an API, experience a similar method to refactor dialog, and support multiple ways to open this dialog, including the replication line label generation method of the interface to quickly fix the Generate intent in the interface file.

  • You can store the API as a template, for example, you can store the public URL prefix/return type/parameter/suspend keyword in the template, and you can load the template in the dialog to generate the API and quickly fill them.

  • Retrofit annotations for methods and parameters can be updated by intent, which can be found by using the alt+Enter shortcut on methods or parameters.

  • url-based code completion, When you need to complete an interface call or an interface type through a URL, you can enter an 'x', then you can use the URL to find the method and interface class, and enter can directly enter the method corresponding to the URL or the interface class where it is located.

  • liveTemplate, the plugin has a batch of live templates embedded, for example, you can input 'retrofitApi' in the interface file to quickly generate an interface template, and input 'query' in the parameter position to add query parameters. This is useful for creating and modifying interfaces.

If the project's interface documentation supports exporting Open API Specification 3.0 (OAS/swagger), the following features will take effect and can greatly improve development efficiency.

  • You can import remote or local oas into the IDE and view the interface documents in the IDE

  • Interfaces can be grouped by whether they appear in the project or not, and interfaces that have appeared can be navigated between documents and code. The grouping function allows you to quickly find new interfaces during version iteration and version development.

  • In the API creation dialog, the URL can be completed, and after the completion item is applied, the Retrofit API will be automatically generated based on the API document, including the corresponding comments.

  • If you don't use the dialog to generate the API, you can call the completion shortcut to fill in the url and parameter when entering the key of the url and parameter, and the corresponding shortcut can be found in Code-> Code Completion->Basic.

  • You can move the cursor to the position of the parameter and call the intelligent completion of the interface method parameters. The corresponding shortcut keys can be found in Code->Code Completion-> Type-Matching.

data.name: SQLFormatter
data.description:
This is a tool that help you to format query SQL
Usage: right click the current document click the
menu item 'Format SQL' in the Popup Menu to format your current document.
Please feel free to tell us the issue if you have any question about it
https://github.com/petercaogx69/SQLFormatter/issues

data.name: Schema Registry Viewer
data.description:
Browse schemas persisted in external Schema Registry:
  • Review all versions of given schema
  • Graphically visualize complex schemas defined in Apache Avro
  • Compare differences between two schema versions
  • Works with Confluent Apache Kafka and Apache Pulsar Schema Registries

Developers may graphically visualize only Apache Avro format (support for JSON-Schema and Protobuf is under development).

data.name: Citric
data.description:
Citric is an IntelliJ-based plugin that provides framework integration for the Citrus framework.

It offers various tools to generate and validate Citrus related test code, and to aid easier comprehension of Citrus test code in the following areas in all Citrus DSLs (the list is comprehensive):

  • Test frameworks:
    • Recognition of test classes as Citrus JUnit and TestNG test frameworks, e.g. for generating Citrus test methods.
    • Easy navigation from Citrus (.xml, .groovy and .yaml) test source files to test classes and vice versa
    • Validation and generation of Citrus test methods and TestNG specific @CitrusParameters
  • YAML DSL:
    • Comprehensive JSON schema attached to Citrus YAML test files for code completion and validation
  • Endpoints, beans and messages:
    • Code completion of Endpoint, XML and JSON schema and other types of Spring beans, properties in citrus-application.properties, message headers and more.
    • Validation and conversion of @BindToRegistry methods and fields
  • Language injections:
    • Basic syntax highlighting and code completion for Citrus functions and validation matchers.
    • Language injections in several method parameters, XML tags and YAML properties
  • Others:
    • Various Citrus-specific static code analysis checks
    • Line marker icons to navigate to classpath, file and other Citrus test resource files
    • Code folding of certain containers, Hamcrest condition expressions and XML tags for easier comprehension of test code

OSS attributions

This project derives some built-in documentation from the Citrus open source project. This content is licensed under the Apache License v2.

data.name: DryPush: AWS | GCP | Alibaba Deploy & Upload
data.description:
Simplify cloud deployments to AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Alibaba Cloud and other cloud services. 1-2-3-Ready!

AWS Services

  • S3
  • EC2
  • Elastic Beanstalk
  • Lambda
  • Lightsail instances
  • Lightsail buckets

Google Cloud Services

  • GCS
  • GCE
  • Cloud Functions
  • (coming soon) Google Cloud App Engine

Alibaba Cloud Services

  • OSS
  • (coming soon) ECS
  • (coming soon) SAS
  • (coming soon) Function Compute.

Other

  • Any SSH server

Key features

  • Simple 1-click deployments to your cloud. Deploy and run applications, upload files and sites in simple and complex scenarios.
  • IDE Run Configuration integration. Run deployments from IDE and combine with other Run Configurations.
  • Contextual actions. Integrated into Project Tree context menu and Widget for easy access.
  • Various payloads. Supports local files and folders, scripts, Maven and Gradle artifacts, preconfigured IntelliJ Artifacts, stream data from local servers or internet (via URLs).
  • Static website hosting support. Deploy your sites to S3/OSS/GCS buckets, improving website speed and caching.
  • Lambda advanced support. Find/deploy to Lambda@Edge distributions, find/clear dependent CloudFront CDN distributions based on API Gateways using the Lambda function automatically.
  • Lambda layer advanced support. Update Lambda functions and all related functions using given Layers automatically.
  • Lambda@Edge support. Automatic display and deployment to Lambda@Edge.
  • Extensive CloudFront CDN support. Find/clear both directly attached CDN distributions and indirectly attached ones for S3, Lambda, Elastic Beanstalk, EC2, Lightsail.
  • Quick uploads. Save targets with or without payloads for quick 1-click reuse.
  • Multi-uploads. Combine different uploads, save multi-uploads for future 1-click reuse.
  • Multi-region. Work with multiple AWS regions in parallel without any need for switching.
  • Multi-account. Manage several AWS accounts simultaneously.
  • Multi-project. Supports both global (shared) and project-specific AWS credentials, facilitating complex multi-project environments.

Detailed feature description

  • Run/Debug Configuration
    • Enabling users to configure and manage deployments directly in standard IDE's Run Configuration menu.
  • AWS S3 buckets
    • Upload files and directories: Transfer files and entire directories to S3 buckets.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders within S3 buckets.
    • Static website hosting: Host static websites directly from S3.
    • Static website hosting optimization: Enable automatic caching for static content.
    • Invalidate CloudFront distributions: Set automatic invalidation of connected CloudFront CDN caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • AWS Lambda functions and layers
    • Upload function code: Deploy Lambda function code can be uploaded in a few clicks. Assign aliases to function versions and publish versions.
    • Upload layer code: Update layer code for a function, or for all associated functions.
    • Deploy to Lambda@Edge: Deploy functions globally to CloudFront's edge locations.
    • Use S3 for deployment: Optionally utilize S3 buckets for Lambda deployments. Amazon recommends using S3 if the Lambda function code is larger than 10Mb in size.
    • Invalidate CloudFront distributions: Set automatic invalidation of CloudFrontC CDN caches (that are connected via API Gateway) after uploads.
    • Automatic archiving: For non-zip files, DryPush automatically zips the files on the fly for AWS Lambda, to save you time.
    • Supported file types: zip, js, jar, py, rb, ts, json, Go executables, dll.
  • AWS Elastic Beanstalk
    • Deploy applications to environments: Automate deployment to Elastic Beanstalk environments.
    • Remote debug: Enable debug mode for an Elastic Beanstalk application with a single click.
      Note: Make sure your Security Group allows traffic on the specified port
    • Manage versions and descriptions: Track and manage application versions and description.
    • Automatic version increase: When reusing a Quick target, application version would be automatically increased.
    • Invalidate CloudFront distributions: Set automatic invalidation of connected CloudFront CDN caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: zip, js, jar, war, py, rb, Dockerfile, Dockerrun.aws.json, dll, tgz, php.
  • AWS EC2 instances
    • Upload files or applications: Upload files or applications to EC2 instances to the specified folder.
    • Changing IP support: The IP address is determined at deployment time, allowing IP address changes.
    • Run shell commands before and after upload: Execute scripts at different stages of the upload process. For example, to launch an application after it has been uploaded.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders on EC2 instances.
    • Invalidate CloudFront distributions: Set automatic invalidation of CloudFront caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • AWS Lightsail instances
    • Upload files and applications: Upload files or applications to Lightsail instances to the specified folder.
    • Changing IP support: The IP address is determined at deployment time, allowing IP address changes.
    • Run shell commands before and after upload: Execute scripts at different stages of the upload process. For example, to launch an application after it has been uploaded
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders on Lightsail instances.
    • Invalidate Lightsail CDN distributions: Set automatic invalidation of Lightsail CDN distributions caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • AWS Lightsail buckets
    • Upload files and directories: Transfer files and entire directories to Lightsail buckets.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders within Lightsail buckets.
    • Static website hosting optimization: Enable automatic caching for static content.
    • Invalidate Lightsail distributions: Set automatic invalidation of connected Lightsail CDN caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • AWS CloudFront
    • Content delivery network (CDN): Distribute content globally with low latency, DryPush is helping with some key hints.
    • Invalidate distributions: Clear CloudFront caches automatically after your deployments.
    • Advanced use cases:S3/Elastic Beanstalk/EC2 directly-connected distributions, Lambda-indirectly-connected distributions (through API Gateway)
  • Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
    • Multiple Google Cloud projects: supports import Google CLI credentials that can be used with different projects.
    • Upload files and directories: Transfer files and entire directories to GCP Storage buckets.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders within GCP Storage buckets.
    • Static website hosting: Host static websites directly from GCP Storage.
    • Static website hosting optimization: Enable automatic caching for static content.
    • Invalidate Google Cloud CDN distributions: Set automatic invalidation of connected Google Cloud CDN caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • Google Cloud Engine (GCE)
    • Upload files or applications: Upload files or applications to GCP Engine instances to the specified folder.
    • Changing IP support: The IP address is determined at deployment time, allowing IP address changes.
    • Run shell commands before and after upload: Execute scripts at different stages of the upload process. For example, to launch an application after it has been uploaded.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders on GCP Engine instances.
    • Invalidate Google Cloud CDN distributions: Set automatic invalidation of GCP CDN caches after uploads.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • Google Cloud Functions
    • Upload function code: Easily deploy GCP function code, including support for multiple files, with automatic zipping for streamlined deployment.
    • Use GCP Buckets for deployment: Optionally utilize GCP buckets for Function deployments.
    • Auto-zipping files: For your convenience, selected files will be zipped on the fly, if necessary.
    • Supported environments: Deploy to environments such as Node.js, Python, Go, Ruby, PHP, .NET, and Java
    • Supported file types: .zip, .js .go, .php, .py, .ruby, .cs
  • Alibaba Cloud OSS
    • Upload files and directories: Transfer files and entire directories to OSS buckets.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage folders within OSS buckets.
    • Static website hosting: Host static websites directly from OSS.
    • Static website hosting optimization: Enable automatic caching for static content.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • Alibaba Cloud CDN
    • Content delivery network (CDN): Distribute content globally with low latency, DryPush is helping with some key hints.
    • Invalidate CDN distributions: Set automatic invalidation of connected Cloud CDN caches after uploads.
  • Any SSH Server
    • Upload files and applications: Transfer files and applications to any server that supports SSH connection.
    • Run shell commands before and after upload: Execute scripts at different stages of the upload process. For example, to launch an application after it has been uploaded.
    • Manage directory tree: Organize and manage files and folders on remote servers.
    • Supported file types: (any type)
  • Payloads
    • File(s) payload: Supports all local files or folders, either from project or not.
      Quick target's effective payload is:
      • Project Tree selection - if upload is triggered from right click, and it overrides Quick target's saved payload, if it is present.
      • Original Quick target's payload - if upload is triggered from Widget.
    • Maven artifact: Gets the most recent Maven artifact automatically. Scans target folder according to pom.xml configuration, supports standard Maven plugins that change final artifact name.
    • Gradle artifact: Gets the most recent Gradle artifact automatically. Scans build/libs (for Java), build/outputs/apk, build/outputs/apk/debug, build/outputs/apk/release (for Android) folders for files of types: JAR, WAR, EAR, APK.
    • URL payload: Gets the content available via HTTP, HTTPS or FTP URL, and treats it as a single file. Supports basic authentication.
    • IDE Artifact: If your IDE supports artifacts, and you have any configured, the actual content of the artifacts at the moment of upload would be used as payload.
    • Choose later from Project Tree payload: This option is basically NO predefined payload, so actual payload could be chosen later (from Project Tree right click/context menu).
    • Payload override: Selecting payload from project tree, for a Quick target with payload, will override the target's payload.
  • Quick targets, multi-uploads
    • Save upload configuration: You can optionally save an upload configuration, with or without the payload, for further reuse, as 'Quick target'.
    • Widget support: Quick targets with payload could be run from Widget, simplifying access to DryPush features.
    • Payload override: Selecting payload from project tree, for a Quick target with payload, will override the target's payload.
    • Combine upload configurations: Quick targets can be combined into a 'Multi-upload', or 'Multiple Quick target', for further reuse, so that all Quick targets/uploads can be triggered with a single click.
    • Visual help: Dynamic icons of Quick targets and Multi-uploads are based on the chosen target, helping to visually identify them.
  • Multi-account, multi-region, multi-project
    • Multi-account: Create as many accounts/credentials as you like, switching between them when selecting targets is easy.
    • Multi-region: If you have resources in multiple regions, you can select active regions that DryPush will pull resources from, thus eliminating the need to switch regions.
    • Shared and project-bound accounts: To support multi-project environments, credentials could be restricted to a single project, or shared across projects, easing work with multiple projects.

Miscellaneous

  • Visual aesthetics. If you dislike the bright appearance of the DryPush logo in the interface, you can change the icon in plugin settings.
  • Encryption. All passwords and credentials are encrypted with AES-128 encryption.
  • Further development. We are considering AWS containerization services and supporting other cloud providers (GCP, Azure, Alibaba). As we are discussing priorities of features and services to support, your feedback would be greatly appreciated.

Open to feedback!

Your feedback matters! Please email us at drypush.feedback@implemica.com
Your insights and suggestions directly shape the future development of DryPush.
Feel free to shout, curse, or even throw virtual mud!
We appreciate any and all feedback.

data.name: SequenceDiagram.org
data.description:
Official offline version of the SequenceDiagram.org UML sequence diagram tool.

Creating and Editing

  • Create new sequence diagrams: File -> New or Right click in project -> New
  • See instructions and examples for supported sequence diagram elements.

Generating from Java Code

  • Generate sequence diagrams from Java code: Right click inside a method -> Sequence Diagram (in the bottom of the context menu)
  • Sequence diagrams generated from Java code are displayed in the bottom.
  • Click on an arrow in the generated diagram to navigate to the corresponding java method invocation and ctrl/cmd + click to navigate to the definition
  • Click the save icon in the action bar to save the diagram to a location and edit it in the normal main window editor (the save action removes any metadata in the diagram which is used for the previously mentioned navigation)
  • Adjust settings (package filter, limits etc.): File -> Settings -> Tools -> Sequence Diagram Org

Features

  • Text notation scripting and drawing by clicking and dragging in the same model
  • Export to SVG and PNG
  • Syntax highlight and code completion

Limitations

  • Although diagrams exported to SVG contain the diagram source, the diagram source of it cannot be opened and edited using this plugin due to file handling in intellij

If you have any question / comments / suggestions / bugs please contact info@sequencediagram.org. The more feedback we get the better we can prioritize.

data.name: Feign-Helper
data.description:
Feign-Helper is a tool plugin that supports the Spring framework. It helps developers quickly find urls in source code and quickly copy paths in Spring Web Controller. Its most powerful feature is the navigation of the Feign to Controller interface in the Spring Cloud framework.

Features

  • Quickly find urls in the source code;
  • One-click copy Spring Web Controller Path;
  • Feign Navigation to the Controller interface.

Setting

Settings->Tools->Feign Helper
The enable function can be turned off in Settings.

When opening a new project, it may appear that the interface is not scanned, do not worry, you can click on the status bar of the rabbit icon, will rescan. Mouse over the status bar rabbit icon displays the number of Controller methods and Feign interfaces that have been scanned. You can also rescan by clicking Tools ->Reparse Api on the menu bar.

About

Recommend other tools I developed plugins:Database Buddy is a relational database assistance software whose core functions are to support structural comparison between two databases and generate migration scripts.

Go to My home page for more interesting plugins to explore.

data.name: jqExpress
data.description:
JqExpress is a powerful plugin for IntelliJ IDEA that brings seamless JSON querying and transformation capabilities to your development workflow.
Whether you're parsing complex JSON structures or refining data with jq filters, jqExpress empowers you with a robust set of tools right within your IDE.

  • Interactive Filtering: Execute jq filters interactively within your IntelliJ IDEA environment. Visualize the results instantly with the built-in result panel.
  • Native jq Integration: Harness the full potential of jq by seamlessly integrating it into your workflow. Enable native jq filtering with configurable settings.
  • Settings Customization: Tailor jqExpress to match your preferences with customizable settings. Fine-tune filter execution delays and indentation sizes for optimal performance.
  • User-Friendly UI: Intuitive and user-friendly interface with a dedicated Query tab for efficient filtering. Settings tab for configuring native jq integration and other preferences.
  • Real-time Feedback: Instantly see the impact of your jq filters on JSON data. Efficiently debug and refine queries with real-time feedback.
  • Flexible Output Options: Choose between compact or human-readable output with a single click. Tailor the output to match your specific requirements effortlessly.


JqExpress provides a dedicated Settings tab allowing you to customize various aspects of your jq filtering experience.

  • Filter Execution Delay: Set the delay (in milliseconds) for jq filter execution to optimize responsiveness.
  • Indentation Size: Configure the indentation size in the jq filter input field for better readability.
  • Native jq Integration: Enable or disable native jq filtering with easy-to-use toggles.
    While it's not configured jackson-jq is used which has some limitations.
  • Extended jq feature: using --slurp under Settings enables multiple JSON file processing at once by defining a file pattern (e.g. /**/*.json, /src/**/data-*.json, /**/test/**/*.json)

Explore the world of JSON manipulation with the jqExpress plugin - your go-to companion for jq in IntelliJ IDEA!


Third-Party Libraries:

  • jackson-jq: Licensed under the Apache License 2.0. See LICENSE for details.

data.name: SwissKit Converter
data.description:
The all-in-one plugin suite compatible with IntelliJ-based IDEs, brings powerful conversion tools and utilities to streamline your development workflow. From image manipulation and timestamp conversion to measurement conversions, SwissKit offers a comprehensive set of features to enhance your productivity.

Epoch Timestamp Converter

  • Convert Epoch timestamps to human-readable date-time formats and vice versa.
  • Input specific date and time components for precise timestamp creation.

Measurement Converter

  • Seamlessly convert between different measurement units.
  • Support for length, weight, volume, and more.
  • An intuitive interface for quick and accurate unit conversions.

Image Format Converter

  • Convert image formats easily.
  • Support for various image formats via a dropdown menu.
  • Batch conversion with progress tracking.

Image Resizer

  • Resize images with precision and batch processing.
  • Seamlessly handle image dimensions and percentages.
  • Monitor progress with a built-in loader spinner.

Image Watermarker

  • Effortlessly add watermarks to images.
  • Customize watermark text and appearance.
  • Enhance branding and content protection.

SwissKit, your ultimate companion for versatile and efficient conversions in IntelliJ-based IDEs!

Third-Party Libraries:

SwissKit utilizes the following third-party libraries for enhanced functionality:

  • javax.measure:unit-api
  • tech.units:indriya
  • systems.uom:systems-common

data.name: JSON Schema Visualizer/Editor
data.description:
This plugin contributes a powerful, expressive visual schema diagram editor (Design mode) for editing JSON Schemas in your preferred IDE. The structure of the JSON Schema Visualizer/Editor is designed to be intuitive and easy to use. It was created to help both content authors who want to visualize or understand a schema and schema designers who develop complex schemas.


The Design mode includes various navigation features, contextual menu actions, automatic validation, and you can move and edit components directly within the diagram. It supports the following JSON Schema specification versions:

  • 2020-12 (latest)
  • 2019-09
  • Draft 7
  • Draft 6
  • Draft 4

data.name: Magnolia CMS Integration
data.description:
Magnolia CMS Integration:

Autocomplete, Documentation, Highlighting and other tools for the efficient Magnolia developer!

Features:

  • Custom Editor for Freemarker files. (Change file association to "Magnolia Freemarker" on ftl files to enable)
    • Adds autocomplete, full element documentation, highlighting and more.
    • Detects inline expressions, directives, expressions and user directives.
    • Supports new structure View.
    • Autocomplete options
    • Wide-ranging Magnolia documentation
  • Magnolia YAML patterns
    • Autocomplete for special types (dialog types, field types, action types etc.)
    • Java & Light-Module detection & interlinking
    • Templates for common Magnolia-patterns (Start typing "m:" for options)
  • And much more

The plugin was developed for and tested with Magnolia CMS version 6+.

Hints

  • For the Freemarker editor, we highly recommend setting the severity level for html elements during code inspection to a lower level as HTML can sometimes be interrupted by templating code.
  • "Help, my autocomplete seems broken in .ftl files": Validate the file type association. A quick indicator is the file icon, which should display the scipio logo in the lower right corner. If missing, go to "Settings" > "File Types" > "Magnolia Freemarker" > List should include ".ftl". Add if missing

Made by certified Magnolia developers

The integration is the work of Ilscipio, a Magnolia Gold Partner:

After having worked with Magnolia on a range of client projects, we kept looking for ways to improve our own productivity.

We had previous experience on the development of JetBrains plugins (mostly for clients, but also for our own e-commerce framework "Scipio ERP"), and so we figured: why not give it a shot? The plugin has now become something we use in our daily work.

So this is it, a token of love for all things Magnolia CMS and a deep appreciation for the JetBrains crew!

Bugs & Feature Requests

If you have any questions, feature requests or stumble upon the occasional bug, come leave us a message at Ilscipio

data.name: Firebase Firestore
data.description:
Firebase Firestore Plugin

Integrates seamlessly with Firebase Firestore, offering an intuitive and powerful interface for managing Firestore data and executing queries.

Features

  • Connect to Firebase Firestore with ease, supporting both cloud and emulator instances.
  • Browse and Manage Collections and Documents in Table or JSON views.
  • Query Firestore using a Simple Query Language with advanced autocomplete features.
  • Firestore Operations: Add, update, and delete documents directly within the IDE.
  • Save Queries: Store frequently used queries in Favorites.
  • Export and Import Data: Support for formats like CSV and JSON.
  • And much more!

Troubleshooting

Encounter an issue or have a suggestion? Please create a GitHub issue.

data.name: Flexible Freemarker
data.description:
A complete Freemarker editor and IDE for IntelliJ IDEA. This is a full, ground-up implementation of the Freemarker language with comprehensive IDE support, custom macro definitions, and team collaboration features.

Features:

  • Complete Freemarker language implementation with full IDE support
    • Dedicated Freemarker editor built from scratch (Change file association to "Flexible Freemarker" on ftl files to enable)
    • Define your own Freemarker macros & functions with documentation & autocomplete through our Project Editor (File -> Settings -> Tools > Flexible Freemarker)
    • Import & Export all customizations to share with your team
    • Full autocomplete, element documentation, syntax highlighting and error detection
    • Recognizes inline expressions, directives, expressions and user directives
    • Supports structure view for template navigation
    • Context-aware code completion for all Freemarker constructs
    • Real-time validation and error detection
    • Smart handling of mixed HTML/CSS/JS within templates

Hints

  • Create your own functions and macros with our settings editor (File -> Settings -> Tools > Flexible Freemarker)
  • Settings are stored per project
  • For the Freemarker editor, we strongly recommend setting the severity level for html elements during code inspection to a lower level as HTML can sometimes be interrupted by templating code
  • "Help, my autocomplete seems broken in .ftl files": Validate the file type association. A quick indicator is the file icon, which should display the scipio logo in the lower right corner. If missing, go to "Settings" > "File Types" > "Flexible Freemarker" > List should include ".ftl". Add if missing

Made by developers with a love for Freemarker

The integration is the work of Ilscipio:

We use Freemarker for many of our project frameworks (e.g.: Scipio ERP, Magnolia CMS) and love the framework for the power it provides. We have had great interaction with the community in the past.

This plugin is a complete reimplementation of Freemarker language support. We built it because we needed better IDE support for our extensive use of custom macros and functions. Rather than just adding basic highlighting, we created a full Freemarker development environment that understands the entire language and lets you extend it with your own definitions.

We figured this could be a useful tool to have for all the other Freemarker developers out there, so here it is :)

  • Special discounts are available for individual developers & of course for the whole Open Source community.
  • Original Freemarker contributors can contact us for a 100% discount.

Bugs & Feature Requests

If you have any questions, feature requests or stumble upon the occasional bug, come leave us a message at Ilscipio

data.name: Soteri Secret Scanner
data.description:
Detect Secrets While Developing

A real-time IntelliJ vulnerability scanner that detects secrets in your code and queries. Mitigate data leaks early in the development process with this local scanner.

Secrets should trigger warnings just like forgotten commas. With Soteri Secret Scanner they do.

Soteri Secret Scanner helps developers and teams:

  • Commit code and run queries without secrets

  • Gain peace of mind knowing a common mistake doesn't go undetected

  • Protect your company from a data breach rooting from data leaks

  • Mitigate security vulnerabilities as early as possible

Features

  • Real-time detection of API keys, passwords, financial information, and other secrets

  • 40+ built-in detection patterns for a wide range of secrets

  • Ignore false positives with a click of a button (which adds a pragma next to the alleged secret)

How the Scanner Works

  • Add a secret such as an API key

  • A warning will show up similar to the ones for syntax issues

  • Hovering over the secret will give you the options to remove it or add a pragma to ignore it

Privacy ğŸ”’

Soteri respects data sovereignty, ensuring your sensitive information remains secure, confined and never transmitted elsewhere. In other words, we don't phone home.

How to Install

  1. Open settings and select "Plugins"

  2. Click the "Marketplace" tab

  3. Search for "Soteri Secret Scanner"

  4. Click install

FAQs

Do you have access to my code or secrets?

Absolutely not. This plugin is 100% local and never transmits data elsewhere.

What types of security vulnerabilities does this scan for?

Soteri is dedicated to mitigating one of the most dangerous security vulnerabilities â€“ data leaks. Therefore, the scanner is focused on finding secrets in your code and queries.

Will this stop my code from compiling?

No, Soteri Secret Scanner is a visual inspection tool that detects security issues as you type.

I'm looking for a feature that doesn't exist. Where can I request it?

We'd love to hear ideas from you! Please submit any feedback here.

What languages does this support?

Soteri Secret Scanner is language agnostic. You can use any language or framework and the scanner will effectively detect secrets. That's because the scanner works by detecting various patterns in the secrets, not variable names, for example.

Why use this locally?

Preventing data leaks requires multiple layers. Ideally, they are caught before ever leaving your computer. If a secret winds up in a commit or log, the secret should be considered compromised and should be immediately revoked or rotated. It's essential to treat any exposed secret as a potential security breach, acting swiftly to mitigate risks. Therefore, it's an essential proactive step to mitigate mistakes early on, i.e., locally

Data Leak Detection at All Stages

Take a comprehensive approach to mitigating data leaks by catching them throughout the development process:

  1. Get warned about secrets in your own code as you paste them in (this plugin)

  2. Block commits containing secrets (Security for Bitbucket)

  3. Find secrets in the codebase and all past commits (Security for Bitbucket)

Install now to proactively detect secrets in your code!

data.name: IntelliPHP - AI Autocomplete for PHP
data.description:
IntelliPHP is a local AI-powered extension for IntelliJ IDEs that enhances productivity and code development experience for PHP.

Full-Line code completions

IntelliPHP leverages artificial intelligence to provide intelligent code predictions in form of full-line code completions. As you type, the extension suggests relevant code completions and shows them as grey text in your editor. This feature helps you write code faster and reduces the time spent on manual typing.

Offline Mode

IntelliPHP operates locally on your machine, which means it doesn't require an Internet connection. Your code and typing activity remains private, and no data is sent outside your computer. Enjoy the benefits of AI-assisted development without sacrificing your privacy.

No API Keys

Unlike some AI-powered tools, IntelliPHP doesn't require any API keys or external services to function. It works seamlessly within your Visual Studio Code environment, simplifying the setup process and eliminating the need for additional configuration steps.

Supported Platforms

IntelliPHP supports ARM and x64 versions of Windows and Mac OS X, as well as x64 versions of Linux operating systems. Regardless of your preferred platform, you can take advantage of IntelliPHP's AI capabilities to boost your PHP development workflow.

Feedback and Support

We value your feedback and are committed to continuously improving IntelliPHP. If you encounter any issues, have suggestions for new features, or need assistance, please reach out to us through one of the following channels:

Community Forum: Join our developer community at community.devsense.com and engage in discussions, ask questions, and share your experiences with IntelliPHP.

GitHub: Submit bug reports, feature requests by visiting our GitHub repository.

Twitter: Follow us on Twitter @php4vs and @IntelliPHP for the latest updates and news related to IntelliPHP.

Join our community of developers and experience the power of AI-assisted PHP development with IntelliPHP for IntelliJ platforms!

data.name: Extra IDE Tweaks
data.description:
Some utilities for IDE maintenance and tweaking, plus workarounds for a few IDE issues. See Tools > Extra IDE Tweaks.

License types:
- Extra IDE Tweaks offers monthly and yearly licenses.
- Extra IDE Tweaks Lifetime (new!) offers lifetime licenses: pay once, use it and get updates forever.

There are two different plugins because JetBrains does not allow plugin developers to offer all the license types (monthly/yearly and lifetime) for the same plugin. Both plugins offer the exact same features. The only difference is the license.

Features:
  • The Open Editors tool window shows opened files in all editors belonging to the opened project, as in VSCode. It can also display a list of recently opened files, as in the Recent Files action.
  • Can make folder icons more visible (with no outline style) when using the New UI. You can also use it with the regular UI.
  • Can change most tool windows label. Per example, rename the "Pull Requests" tool window to "PR".
  • Can confirm the opening of sensitive files. May be useful when streaming and/or accidentally opening a sensitive file in situations where you can leak critical information.
  • Can open projects located in trusted locations directly via File > Trusted Locations, just after Recent Projects.
  • Can register your favorite projects, organize them with optional groups, and gain fast access to your favorite projects via File > Favorite Projects, just after Recent Projects and Trusted Locations.
  • Can define default Excluded Folders (not per-project). There is now a global list of excluded folders. Go to Extra IDE Tweaks settings for details.
  • Commit Alert: this inspection allows you to define keywords that will show a confirmation dialog before committing files containing any of those keywords. Per example, define the COMMIT_ALERT keyword, modify, delete or move one or multiple files containing it, then commit. A confirmation dialog will appear asking if you still want to commit.
  • Activate All Tool Windows: this action activates all available tool windows in the current project. Enable it in settings, then see the "Window > Activate All Tool Windows" menu item. It's like clicking on the "..." button on the left-side toolbar, then clicking on each available tool window.
  • Can register any program and add it to the "Open In" list when doing a right-click on a file, a folder, or a project. Your program will be added next to the "Open In" Terminal action. That means you can open files and folders with your favorite program (like ForkLift, Total Commander, Vim...). You can register up to 2 "Open In" actions. Go to Extra IDE Tweaks settings for details.
    You can also open files with Associated Application. This additional action is enabled for IDEs prior to 2024 only, as it is already implemented by 2024+ IDEs.
  • Can open a folder as a Project via the "Open In" menu.
  • Can rename tab names to remove the parenthesis after the file names if they're located in the root project or module. Per example, renames "build.gradle.kts (my-module)" to "build.gradle.kts". For now, it works with "build.gradle", "build.gradle.kts", "build.gradle.dcl", "settings.gradle", "settings.gradle.kts" "settings.gradle.dcl" and "src/main/resources/META-INF/plugin.xml" files only.
  • Can purge IDE's plugin download cache, or its image cache only. This is a workaround for known IDE limitation ğŸ› IJPL-6179.
  • Can schedule the IDE's GC.
  • Can schedule the GC on local JVMs. May be useful when having multiple Gradle or Kotlin Compiler daemons consuming too much memory. You can choose to run the GC on selected JVMs: all local JVMs, or by filtering by JVM instance name with your own regexes.
  • Adds a Properties action to the File and Folder context menu that shows information like size, number of files, etc.
  • Adds a menu item under Tools in order to access the Plugins Manager faster.
  • Offers a workaround for known IDE issue ğŸ› IDEA-341174: the Git tool window may display the wrong label "Version Control" instead of "Git".
Extra IDE Tweaks Chinese UI is automatically applied if you enable the official IDE Chinese Language Pack plugin. For 2024.2+ IDEs, you need to select the Chinese locale in File > Appearance & Behavior > System Settings > Language and Region.

data.name: Tailwind Fold
data.description:
Tailwind Fold

We all love Tailwind CSS, but sometimes it can be a bit verbose. This plugin will help you fold the classes to make your templates more readable. Enable Tailwind Fold plugin and enjoy the clean code and better readability. If you are annoyed by other html attributes or your custom ones then you can customize them in plugin settings.

The plugin will allow you to fold class attributes in HTML, Vue templates, Svelte templates and JavaScript/TypeScript files that create templates.

Supported filetypes:

  • HTML
  • Vue HTML templates
  • Svelte HTML templates
  • React JSX templates
  • HTML templates inside JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Astro HTML templates

Plans:

Free

Freemium

Class attribute collapsing

Can customize any attributes

Can collapse/expand all tags globally

Can collapse/expand all tags globally

X

Can collapse customized attributes in all tags in file/p>

X

Can expand customized attributes in all tags in file/p>

Useful shortcuts:

  1. Expand/Collapse All attributes use shortcut (Shift + cmd + P on Mac or Shift + Ctrl + P on Windows). This is going to change global setting. If you had previously opened files their expand/collapse state will change after you navigate to the file and start making some changes. IDE doesn't force file rerendering before your action.
  2. To expand/collapse "class" attribute under cursor use default IDE code folding shortcut (Cmd + dot on Mac or Ctrl + . on Windows). If your cursor is between attribute value start and end then using shortcut will collapse attribute value.
  3. You can open collapsed area by clicking on collapsed attribute value placeholder. In default configuration clicking on "..." will open its value.

Paid version shortcuts:

  1. Fold All Attributes shortcut (Shift + cmd + F on Mac or Shift + Ctrl + F on Windows) - fold all attributes in active file
  2. Expand All Attributes shortcut (Shift + cmd + C on Mac or Shift + Ctrl + C on Windows) - fold all attributes in active file

Feel free to remap shortcuts in IDE settings -> keymap -> "shortcut name"

Support Plugin Developer:

If you like the plugin, and you are using free version of that, please consider supporting Me or subscribing for the plugin.

Support my work

data.name: Smart Tomcat Pro
data.description:
Smart Tomcat Pro: Smart, Powerful, Redefined

SmartTomcat Pro is a powerful plugin for IntelliJ IDEA, available for both Community and Ultimate editions, designed to enhance the experience of working with Apache Tomcat servers. It provides developers with robust tools to run and debug applications efficiently on Tomcat.

This essential plugin supports Tomcat versions 7 and above, making it an indispensable tool for developers utilizing IntelliJ IDEA for their Tomcat-based projects.

Key Features

  • Seamlessly configure and manage run/debug settings for Tomcat servers.
  • Deploy applications from directories
  • Easily handle multiple deployments on a single Tomcat instance.
  • Configure HTTPS, AJP, Admin ports, and other settings effortlessly.
  • View and manage Tomcat logs directly within the IntelliJ IDEA interface.
  • Specify and use different JDKs for your Tomcat server instances.
  • Comprehensive management of Tomcat server instances within the IDE.
  • Multiple Instance Support:** Run and manage multiple Tomcat server instances concurrently.
  • [Paid] Deploy applications from IntelliJ Artifacts and WAR files.
  • [Paid] Smoothly integrate with projects managed by Gradle and Maven.
  • [Paid] Deploy applications within the webapps folder of the Tomcat home directory.
  • [Paid] Unlimited deployments (Free version supports up to 2 deployments).
  • [Paid] More features to come!

SmartTomcat Pro enhances productivity and streamlines development workflows for developers using Tomcat and IntelliJ IDEA, making it a must-have plugin for any professional working in this environment.

data.name: Extra Tools Pack
data.description:
Extra Tools Pack provides the exact same features as Extra Icons, Extra IDE Tweaks and Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons. It's offered at a lower price than if you bought each plugin individually.

Features from Extra Icons

Make your IDE more pleasant to use:
  • Adds 500+ icons for files like Travis YML, GitLab YML, Angular files, etc. Many icons have variants, so if you are not happy with the default icon, you can choose another.
  • Shows an icon for Git submodule folders.
  • Highly configurable: see File > Settings > Appearance & Behavior > Extra Icons to select extra icons to (de)activate. This is configurable at IDE and project level.
  • You can register your own icons in order to define custom icons for certain files or file patterns.
  • You can override almost all IDE icons, including toolbars, menus, etc.
  • You can import and export icons from external files. This also means you can easily share icon themes with friends. You can also download online icon packs (example: restore the old file icons when using the new UI).
  • For more information, please see the online documentation.
  • JetBrains Gateway is no longer supported (it actually has never been fully supported).

Features from Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons

Makes tool window and control icons colorful. This feature is based on the ToolWindow Colorful Icons plugin and adds several new icons. You can also choose icons to (de)activate: see Settings > Appearance & Behavior > Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons.
You will get the exact same features as using Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons with a paid license.

Features from Extra IDE Tweaks

Some utilities for IDE maintenance and tweaking, plus workarounds for a few IDE issues. See Tools > Extra IDE Tweaks. Features:
  • The Open Editors tool window shows opened files in all editors belonging to the opened project, as in VSCode. It can also display a list of recently opened files, as in the Recent Files action.
  • Can make folder icons more visible (with no outline style) when using the New UI. You can also use it with the regular UI.
  • Can change most tool windows label. Per example, rename the "Pull Requests" tool window to "PR".
  • Can confirm the opening of sensitive files. May be useful when streaming and/or accidentally opening a sensitive file in situations where you can leak critical information.
  • Can open projects located in trusted locations directly via File > Trusted Locations, just after Recent Projects.
  • Can register your favorite projects, organize them with optional groups, and gain fast access to your favorite projects via File > Favorite Projects, just after Recent Projects and Trusted Locations.
  • Can define default Excluded Folders (not per-project). There is now a global list of excluded folders. Go to Extra IDE Tweaks settings for details.
  • Commit Alert: this inspection allows you to define keywords that will show a confirmation dialog before committing files containing any of those keywords. Per example, define the COMMIT_ALERT keyword, modify, delete or move one or multiple files containing it, then commit. A confirmation dialog will appear asking if you still want to commit.
  • Activate All Tool Windows: this action activates all available tool windows in the current project. Enable it in settings, then see the "Window > Activate All Tool Windows" menu item. It's like clicking on the "..." button on the left-side toolbar, then clicking on each available tool window.
  • Can register any program and add it to the "Open In" list when doing a right-click on a file, a folder, or a project. Your program will be added next to the "Open In" Terminal action. That means you can open files and folders with your favorite program (like ForkLift, Total Commander, Vim...). You can register up to 2 "Open In" actions. Go to Extra IDE Tweaks settings for details.
    You can also open files with Associated Application. This additional action is enabled for IDEs prior to 2024 only, as it is already implemented by 2024+ IDEs.
  • Can open a folder as a Project via the "Open In" menu.
  • Can rename tab names to remove the parenthesis after the file names if they're located in the root project or module. Per example, renames "build.gradle.kts (my-module)" to "build.gradle.kts". For now, it works with "build.gradle", "build.gradle.kts", "build.gradle.dcl", "settings.gradle", "settings.gradle.kts" "settings.gradle.dcl" and "src/main/resources/META-INF/plugin.xml" files only.
  • Can purge IDE's plugin download cache, or its image cache only. This is a workaround for known IDE limitation ğŸ› IJPL-6179.
  • Can schedule the IDE's GC.
  • Can schedule the GC on local JVMs. May be useful when having multiple Gradle or Kotlin Compiler daemons consuming too much memory. You can choose to run the GC on selected JVMs: all local JVMs, or by filtering by JVM instance name with your own regexes.
  • Adds a Properties action to the File and Folder context menu that shows information like size, number of files, etc.
  • Adds a menu item under Tools in order to access the Plugins Manager faster.
  • Offers a workaround for known IDE issue ğŸ› IDEA-341174: the Git tool window may display the wrong label "Version Control" instead of "Git".
Extra Tools Pack Chinese UI is automatically applied if you enable the official IDE Chinese Language Pack plugin. For 2024.2+ IDEs, you need to select the Chinese locale in File > Appearance & Behavior > System Settings > Language and Region.

data.name: SSHMatrix
data.description:
SSHMatrix is a powerful SSH tool that caters to all your remote server management needs. Whether you're a system administrator, a developer, or an IT professional, SSHMatrix offers excellent performance and a wide array of features.

  • Shell Command Support:

    • SSHMatrix supports all shell commands, from basic ones like "ls", "cd", "mv", to more complex ones like "grep", "awk", "sed", and so on. This means you can execute any command you need directly from the SSHMatrix interface, without having to open any other command line tools.

  • SFTP Support:

    • In addition to basic shell commands, SSHMatrix also supports SFTP (SSH File Transfer Protocol). You can easily upload and download files using SSHMatrix, without the need for any other FTP clients. Moreover, since SFTP uses the SSH protocol, all file transfers are encrypted, ensuring the security of your files.

  • Tunnel Support:

    • SSHMatrix also provides SSH tunneling capabilities. You can create SSH tunnels to forward ports, which can be incredibly useful for bypassing firewalls, accessing internal network resources, or enhancing network security.

  • User-Friendly Interface:

    • The interface of SSHMatrix is designed to be clean and intuitive, allowing for quick and easy usage. All features are clearly labeled and explained, making it easy even for those new to SSH to use SSHMatrix.

  • Powerful Performance:

    • SSHMatrix uses the latest SSH protocols and encryption technologies to ensure stable and secure connections. Whether you need to manage tens or hundreds of servers, SSHMatrix can handle it with ease.


In conclusion, SSHMatrix is an all-in-one SSH tool that brings together shell commands, SFTP, and SSH tunneling capabilities, making your server management tasks much easier. Whether you're new to SSH or an expert, SSHMatrix can cater to your needs.

data.name: JTracker: MyBatis Log & JPA Log
data.description:
JTracker is a java code tracking tool that allows you to quickly locate where MyBatis and JPA SQL is executing and the call trace.

Features
  • Support for complete recovery of SQL statements executed by MyBatis and JPA
  • Support for viewing the execution of SQL statements
  • Support for navigating to the location where the SQL is executed
  • Support for viewing trace links for executing SQL code

Supported databases
  • H2
  • SQLite
  • MySQL
  • MariaDB
  • ClickHouse
  • Microsoft SQL Server
  • OceanBase
  • PostgreSQL
  • Trino
  • Presto
  • PostGIS
  • CrateDB
  • Oracle
  • KingBase
  • Dameng
  • More...

data.name: HTMX Pro
data.description:
HTMX Pro plugin provides comprehensive support for the htmx library in JetBrains IDEs.

Features

  • Provides advanced coding assistance, including syntax highlighting, code completions, quick documentation, and inspections
  • Supports HTML and various templating languages, including JSX and TSX
  • Enables JavaScript language features with full type information in hx-on event handlers, hx-trigger event filters, and hx-vals, hx-request and hx-headers attributes
  • Enables CSS language features in selectors with support for the extended CSS selector syntax
  • Provides support for navigating and auto-completing endpoints within URLs
  • Provides support for HTMX extensions (enabled from Settings â†’ Languages & Frameworks â†’ HTMX)

Licenses

Due to marketplace limitations, different licensing options are offered as separate plugins:
  • HTMX Pro (Lifetime) offers perpetual licenses.
  • HTMX Pro offers monthly and yearly licenses.
Both plugins share the same functionality.

data.name: Snapshots for AI
data.description:
Snapshots for AI helps generate machine-readable markdown snapshots of files that users are currently working on. This plugin empowers developers by providing an efficient way to document and share their codebase structure and content with large languages models (LLMS) such as ChatGPT, Claude.AI, and Grok, enabling a new level of interaction and analysis with your code.

The plugin offers flexible configuration options, allowing users to include or exclude specific files and patterns, ensuring that only the relevant parts of the project are captured. Additionally, users can choose to document the entire project structure or focus on individual files, tailoring the snapshots to their specific needs. With Snapshots for AI, you can enhance your development workflow, improve documentation practices, and leverage the power of AI to take your coding experience to new heights.

data.name: CodeQL
data.description:
Provides support for CodeQl files.

Features:
  • Syntax Highlighting
  • Basic Code Completion
  • LSP Support

data.name: SequenceDiagram JS
data.description:
JavaScript language extension for SequenceDiagram 4.x support JavaScript, TypeScript.

Plugin Compatibility and Licensing

This plugin is designed to work in conjunction with SequenceDiagram Core. If you attempt to use this plugin without having SequenceDiagram Core enabled, it will not function as intended.

Licensing Requirements

Please note that this plugin is a paid feature, which means it requires a separate subscription to utilize. This applies even if you have already subscribed to SequenceDiagram Core.

Key Points:

  • This plugin is compatible only with SequenceDiagram Core.
  • Without SequenceDiagram Core, the plugin will be ineffective.
  • This is a paid plugin that requires a separate subscription to function.

Please install SequenceDiagram Core 4.x first.

Note : This plugin depend on SequenceDiagram Core.

data.name: kotlin-parameter-object
data.description:
Kotlin Parameter Object

Simplify complex Kotlin function signatures with ease. This plugin introduces a powerful refactoring tool that extracts multiple function arguments into a single, organized params class.

Key Features:

  • Automatic creation of a params class for functions with multiple arguments
  • Automatic creation of a params class for selected functions argument
  • Refactoring of function signatures to use the new params class
  • Updating of function bodies to utilize the params class
  • Automatic adjustment of all function calls throughout the project

Benefits:

  • Improves code readability by reducing function parameter lists
  • Enhances maintainability by grouping related parameters
  • Simplifies function calls and makes them more descriptive
  • Facilitates easier addition or removal of parameters in the future
  • Streamlines documentation and reduces the cognitive load when working with complex functions

Boost your productivity and code quality with this essential refactoring tool!

Usage:

  • Directly from function Context Menu
  • Directly from function parameters selection Context Menu
  • Use cmd + alt + E keyboard shortcut
  • Right-click on a function name â†’ Refactor â†’ Extract Arguments to Params Class

data.name: Manage Projects
data.description:
Project Management

This is a powerful tool designed specifically for IntelliJ IDEA users, aimed at helping developers better organize and manage their projects. The plugin offers a rich set of features that enable you to easily group, sort, add descriptions, and set labels for your projects, thereby significantly enhancing their manageability and maintainability.

Main Features

  • Grouping and Sorting: Allows you to flexibly group and sort projects according to personal preferences or team standards, making the project structure clearer and more organized.
  • Add Descriptions: Supports adding detailed condition descriptions to projects, helping team members quickly understand the background, status, and relevant requirements of the project.
  • Label Setting: By setting labels, you can add additional metadata to projects, facilitating subsequent searching and categorization.
  • Enhanced Project View: Provides an enhanced project view that makes browsing, searching, and filtering projects more intuitive and efficient.
  • Scan Directory: Add all folders in the specified directory to the project group view.
  • Shortcut toggles open projects: Use the control alt P shortcut key to select an open item to switch

data.name: PR-SnapView
data.description:
Summary:

The PR-SnapView plugin provides an efficient way to monitor and manage GitHub Pull Requests directly from your JetBrains IDE. It generates a dynamic HTML dashboard that displays pull requests in a user-friendly card view format, consolidating essential PR information for quick and easy review.

Key Features:

  • Comprehensive PR Dashboard: View all critical PR details including title, review decisions, review requests, and more, without needing to open each PR individually.
  • Interactive Card View: Each PR is displayed as a card, highlighting key details such as commit ID, assignees, and related Jira issues.
  • Quick Access Links: Directly access PR URLs and related Jira issues from within the dashboard for streamlined navigation.
  • Copy Commit ID: Easily copy the last commit ID with a single click for quick reference and usage.

Benefits:

  • Enhanced Efficiency: Save time navigating between multiple PRs by consolidating important information into a single view.
  • Improved Visibility: Gain quick insights into PR statuses and key details, helping with better project management and tracking.
  • Seamless Integration: Access PR information and related Jira issues directly within your IDE, creating a smoother workflow.

Supported Operating Systems:

The plugin is recommended for macOS and Linux for optimal performance. It is also compatible with Windows.

Getting Started:

  • Installation:
    • Launch your JetBrains IDE and open the plugin settings at Preferences > Plugins > Marketplace.
    • Search for "PR-SnapView" and install it.
  • Prerequisites: Follow our Prerequisites guide for a step-by-step list of requirements to prepare your environment.
  • Quick Start Guide: Follow our Quick Start guide for a step-by-step guide with screenshots to get up and running quickly.

data.name: PR-FlowTracker
data.description:
Summary:

PR-FlowTracker is a powerful and dynamic plugin that empowers you to track Pull Requests (PRs) on GitHub directly within your JetBrains IDE. Effortlessly monitor PR statuses and access essential information in a clear, organized manner, streamlining the journey from opening to merging your PRs and boosting project management efficiency.

Key Features:

  • Comprehensive PR Tracking: Monitor all open PRs and their statuses, including changes, review requests, and conflicts, without needing to open each PR individually.
  • User-Friendly Interface: A clear interface allows for quick browsing of key PR information, such as titles, labels, and statistics.
  • Easy Access to Details: Directly access detailed information about each PR, facilitating navigation and speeding up the review process.
  • Conflict Management: Quickly identify and manage merge conflicts and other issues related to PRs.

Benefits:

  • Enhanced Efficiency: Save time navigating through multiple PRs by consolidating essential information in one place.
  • Improved Visibility: Gain quick insights into PR statuses and key details, aiding better project management.
  • Seamless Integration: Access PR information directly within your IDE, creating a smoother workflow.

Supported Operating Systems:

The plugin is recommended for macOS and Linux for optimal performance. It is also compatible with Windows.

Getting Started:

  • Installation:
    • Launch your JetBrains IDE and open the plugin settings at Preferences > Plugins > Marketplace.
    • Search for "PR-FlowTracker" and install it.
  • Prerequisites: Follow our Prerequisites guide for a step-by-step list of requirements to prepare your environment.
  • Quick Start Guide: Follow our Quick Start guide for a step-by-step guide with screenshots to get up and running quickly.

data.name: Smart Input Pro (Japan, South Korea, Russia & more)
data.description:
Automatically switch input method according to the position of the cursor. Displays the current language on the cursor. Avoid typos and coding errors caused by language switching. This feature is particularly beneficial for developers whose mother tongue is not English, such as Chinese, Japanese, Korean and Russian, etc. At the same time, it is also a necessary extension of IdeaVim. Key word: SmartInput, Smart Input Pro.

If your native language is not Chinese, you need to access another plugin. Smart Input Pro (Japan, South Korea, Russia & more)

What problems are solved

Many developers in the world are not English. Developers often need to switch between mother tongue and English input method in the process of writing code. Sometimes it is not clear which input method is currently used, which seriously affects coding efficiency.

In fact, in many specific scenarios, which input method needs to be used is very clear. In this way, you can let the IDE help us switch the input method automatically. Smart Input Pro is to help programmers improve coding efficiency. Its core function is to help you switch to the input method you want in the determined scenario. In more aspects, it will help programmers to improve coding efficiency.

Solution

Smart input Pro Integrate to the IDE by plug-in. It can intelligently analyze what scenarios are currently in the context of the input position and what input method is needed, and automatically switch to the corresponding input method. It can also remind users which input method to use by cursor color. Next list several core scenarios of the Intellij IDE.

  • Default Scenario: Most of the mainstream programming languages can only enter ASCII in the default area (except the annotation area and the string area), and the input method is automatically switched to the English input method when the default scenario is recognized.
  • Comment Scenario: Most developers will choose to use their mother tongue when writing code comments. Even if you need to enter simple English, you can use the mother tongue input method. In this scenario, the input method will be automatically switched to the mother tongue input method.
  • Git Commit Scenario: Most developers will choose to use their mother tongue when writing git commit message. Even if you need to enter simple English, you can use the mother tongue input method. In this scenario, the input method will be automatically switched to the mother tongue input method.
  • Tool Window Scenario: Many tool windows require specific input methods, such as Project and Terminal requires English input methods. The plug-in can identify the current tool window and switch to the corresponding input method.
  • Ideavim Scenario: Vim needs to use the English input method when the Normal mode, otherwise the input will not take effect. When the plug-in recognizes the Normal mode, it will be automatically switched to the English input method. When the plug-in recognizes the INSERT mode, the input method is switched according to the scenario of the cursor.
  • String Scenario: When you enter the string word, you need to use different input methods according to the variable names. The plug-in can record your habits and switch to your commonly used input method.
  • Custom Events Scenario: When an event occurs in the IDE, the plug-in will automatically switch to the corresponding input method. For example, when the window of the translation plugin is opened, the plug-in will be switched to the input method as the mother tongue. You can directly enter the mother tongue.
  • Custom Rules Scenario: Scenes that are uncertain input method such as input string, etc. You can use custom regular matching rules. When the strings at the cursor meet specific rules, the plug-in will automatically switch the corresponding input method. For example, when the cursor is between Chinese text, the plug-in will be switched to Chinese input method.
  • Leave the IDE Scenario: Windows System's input method of each app is independent, switch to a certain app to restore the internal input method status, the MAC system does not have this function, so the plug-in can help you achieve this feature.

Support IDE

Smart Input Pro support all IDEs on the Intellij platform, Such as Idea, Pycharm, WebStorm, Goland, PHPSTORM, DataGrip, etc. Android Studio and Deveco Studio are also based on the Intellij platform, so it is also supported. The IDE plug-in of other platforms is under development. Each IDE may support a variety of programming languages. We cannot completely cover all the scenes, so when you encounter a bad experience, you can feedback it to us, we will optimize them one by one.

Support Programming Language

The plug-in supports all programming languages, but the experience of different programming languages may not be the same because different programming language characteristics are different. For example, java, kotlin, C, C++, Python, php, Golang, javascript, typescript, scala, groovy and other programming languages, Only mother tongue can be used in the comment area and string, and other areas can be used in English; HTML, Markdown and other marking languages do not have a very clear input method. Therefore, automatic switching is not turned on by default, but supports the use of cursor colors to indicate the state of input method.

Freemium

This product adopts a value-added payment model. It can be tried value-added functions within 30 days. After the trial, you can use basic functions for free. After activation, value-added functions can be used. Later you can also activate through the following path: Main Menu >> Help >> Register.

  • Automatically switch input method in the Default Scenario. (Free)
  • Displays the current input method on the cursor. (Free)
  • Shows the Caps Lock status on the cursor. (Free)
  • Automatically switch input method in the Comment Scenario. (Paid)
  • Automatically switch input method in the Git Commit Scenario. (Paid)
  • Automatically switch input method in the Tool Window Scenario. (Paid)
  • Automatically switch input method in the Ideavim Scenario. (Paid)
  • Automatically switch input method in the String Scenario. (Paid)
  • Automatically switch input method in the Custom Events Scenario. (Paid)
  • All other functions. (Paid)

data.name: .log
data.description:
Support Log files as a language with:

  • Syntax Highlighting.
  • Navigate to source code from log category or stack trace (Cmd B|Ctrl B).
  • Navigate to next/prev Error/Warning (F2/Shift+F2).
  • Open URI's and file paths as hyperlinks (Cmd B|Ctrl B).
  • Autodetect log format, json logs, ANSI color/style codes.
  • Support large log files

data.name: Base64 File
data.description:
Effortless Base64 work in IDE: encode files of any type to/from Base64, including PNG, SVG, JPG images for embedding in HTML/CSS.
For a detailed overview of its features and functionality, refer to the comprehensive Documentation

Key Features

  • Base64 encoding of project files to other project files
  • Support for multiple encoded files in a single file
  • Maintaining the link between encoded files and their source files
  • Automatic updates of encoded files when the source file is updated
  • Visual indicators for links in the Project Tree
  • Visual marking of encoded files in the editor

Actions Overview

  • Insert Encoded File at Caret in Editor
  • Remove Link to Encoded File at Caret (Keeping Encoded Value)
  • Remove Link to Encoded File at Caret (Deleting Encoded Value)
  • Navigate to Encoded File at Caret
  • Convert Encoding Scheme of Encoded File at Caret
  • Encode File Selected in Project Tree and Insert it at Caret
  • Remove All Links to Encoded Files

Please don't hesitate to report any bugs you encounter here: Bug Tracker. We will address them as quickly as possible. Flawless plugin performance is our priority.
