data.name: GitLab Multi-Repo Search
data.description:
GitLab Multi-Repository Search

Powerful and efficient code search across multiple GitLab repositories within your groups.

Key Features

  • Flexible Authentication: OAuth and Personal Access Token support, secure credential storage.
  • Advanced Search: case-sensitive, whole word matching, file type filtering, path exclusion, branch-specific searches.
  • Smart Group Management: Browse groups, history, quick switching, manual entry.
  • Rich Results Interface: Syntax-highlighted preview, direct GitLab links, export options.

Getting Started

  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Configure GitLab connection.
  3. Select your group.
  4. Start searching!

Requirements

  • IntelliJ-based IDEs (2023.1+).
  • GitLab instance (self-hosted or gitlab.com).
  • Appropriate GitLab access permissions.

Note: This plugin requires a GitLab account and access to repositories.

Contact us at mohamed.boatira@gmail.com for issues or feature requests.

data.name: Maven Plug-in Extensions
data.description:
This plugin enhances Maven support in IDE. (Freemium)

The primary goal of this plugin is to provide seamless, implicit support that extends IntelliJ IDEA's existing Maven functionality. Ideally, users wonâ€™t need to perform any specific configuration to take advantage of it.

Initially, the plugin focuses on supporting the org.codehaus.mojo:properties-maven-plugin, but it is designed with extensibility in mind, enabling future support for additional Maven plugins.

Paid and free features are clearly marked in the plugin description. I reserve the right to adjust the distribution of features between the paid and free versions in future releases. The freemium model keeps me motivated to continue developing the plugin, adding new features, and supporting additional Maven plugins. I aim to designate features as paid when they require a significant investment of time and\or effort to develop. Your understanding and support are greatly appreciated. Additionally, the platform provider may offer discounts or other promotions to make premium features more accessible.

Feedback and suggestions are always welcomeâ€”your input is invaluable and deeply appreciated.

Key Features:

Enhanced Maven support in IntelliJ IDEA.

Currently Supported Plugins:

  • org.codehaus.mojo:properties-maven-plugin

    • read-project-properties

  • org.codehaus.mojo:build-helper-maven-plugin

    • parse-version (formattedVersion) (parsedVersion is supported by Jetbrains plugin)
    • regex-property
    • timestamp-property
    • local-ip
    • hostname
    • cpu-count
    • uptodate-property
    • uptodate-properties

  • io.github.git-commit-id:git-commit-id-maven-plugin (paid)

  • pl.project13.maven:git-commit-id-plugin (versions from 1.0 to 9.0.0) (paid)

    • revision

Details:

  • auto-completion in the pom.xml, *.properties, and plain text files
  • referencing in the pom.xml, *.properties, and plain text files (when they are in filtered resources)
    • plain text and *.properties files supported in paid version

Planned Updates:

Future updates will expand the list of supported Maven plugins based on user and community feedback.

data.name: rch-spring-code-generation
data.description: Plugin for generating Spring Boot code templates including controllers, services, and repositories for both traditional and reactive programming models. Supports automatic code generation with customizable templates.

data.name: AWS CodePipeline Dashboard - Execute & Monitor Pipelines
data.description:
AWS CodePipeline Dashboard for Software Developers

AWS CodePipeline Dashboard is an IntelliJ IDEA plugin designed to simplify managing and monitoring AWS CodePipelines directly from your IDE. This plugin offers a user-friendly interface to streamline your workflows by allowing you to view pipeline statuses, monitor stages, and perform actions without leaving your development environment.

The plugin integrates seamlessly with your AWS environment and supports AWS Profile Credentials configured in your local environment (in ~/.aws folder).


With AWS CodePipeline Dashboard, you can:

  • ğŸ” Quickly view the real-time status of AWS CodePipelines.
  • ğŸ“Š Drill down into detailed information about each pipeline, stage, and action.
  • ğŸ›  Start, stop, and retry pipelines with ease.
  • ğŸŒ™ Enjoy full support for Dark Mode.

â—Important note: The plugin interacts directly with your AWS account using the credentials from your local AWS Profile configuration. These profiles are securely managed using the AWS CLI setup, ensuring no sensitive data is transmitted to third-party servers.


To open the plugin, click on View -> Tool Windows -> CodePipeline.


By using AWS CodePipeline Dashboard, you can save time and boost productivity by managing your pipelines seamlessly from within your IDE. The plugin is easy to configure and provides a smooth, integrated experience tailored for developers working with AWS CodePipelines.

data.name: MicroPython Tools
data.description:
Adds MicroPython support to JetBrains IDEs.


Free features:

  • Upload and synchronize files with MicroPython devices (Serial and WebREPL supported)
  • File System view with drag and drop, create/rename/delete, copy/cut/paste, and download
  • Stub package manager for MicroPython stubs
  • On-device file editing (read-only by default, editable with save-to-device option)
  • REPL integration with reset, interrupt, and clear actions
  • Run configurations for Project, Selected Sources Roots, and Custom Paths
  • Mounted volume support (e.g. SD cards)

Pro features:

  • Background uploads and downloads that wonâ€™t block the IDE
  • Automatic file compression to significantly speed up uploads

Documentation, usage tips, and issue tracker are available on GitHub.

data.name: VHDL Language Support
data.description:
Adds support for VHDL (IEEE 1076-2019) language. The following features are available with IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition:

  • Syntax highlighting
  • Find definition and usages
  • Keywords completion
  • Structure view
  • Documentation tips
  • Error annotation
  • Refactor/Rename(keep original upper/lower case)

Getting started

IntelliJ IDEA is an IDE famous for its ergonomics and intelligent coding assistance it provides for developers coding in Java, JavaScript and other languages. This plugin extends IntelliJ IDEAâ€™s toolset with support for VHDL (IEEE 1076-2019).

Notes:

  • Please be noted that this plugin was intended to be a paid plugin.
  • VHDL (IEEE 1076-2019) features not supported for now:
    1. PSL directives
    2. Conditional analysis
  • Package and Entity are searched with name, regardless of the containing library.

data.name: Jenkinsfile
data.description:
Provides support for the Jenkins pipeline syntax.

Features:

  • Basic code completion
  • Code formatting
  • Structure view

Github | Telegram

data.name: Actionate
data.description:
Actionate pulls GitHub Actions out of the browser and into your JetBrains IDE, eliminating costly context switching and supercharging your CI/CD workflow beyond what's possible in the browser alone.

Documentation

Features

View Workflow Runs

Get a real-time view of both current and past workflow runs right inside your JetBrains IDE.

  • Current and Past Runs
    Monitor in-progress runs in real time and review completed ones at a glance.

  • Powerful Filtering
    Filter runs by branch, actor, event, or status, either individually or in combination, to quickly find exactly what you need.

  • Automatic Discovery
    New runs appear automatically, so you always have up-to-date information with zero extra clicks.

View Comprehensive Workflow Run Details

View every detail of any workflow run including jobs, steps, logs, artifacts, annotations, and all run attempts directly inside your JetBrains IDE, so you can troubleshoot issues and manage everything in one place.

  • Run Metadata
    View details like overall status, triggering event, triggering actor, duration, associated pull request, commit, branch, and the workflow file used.

  • Annotations
    Check run-level or job-level annotations directly in the IDE, and use automatically discovered links to open any referenced URLs in your browser with a single click.

  • Artifacts
    View all artifacts produced by a run, with the option to download and open each one directly in your IDE.

  • Jobs
    View all jobs in a run and their corresponding status at a glance, so you can spot successes or failures instantly.

  • Steps
    See every step in a job along with its status, making it easy to track progress and identify issues.

  • Logs
    View logs of any size for a run, without truncation or size limitations, complete with collapsible log groups and color-coded notices, warnings, and errors. Automatic link detection turns external URLs and project file references into clickable links, letting you open them in your browser or jump straight to the file in your IDE. Smart Log navigation enables you to easily jump to the beginning or end of your logs, or directly to notices, warnings, and errors, for a more streamlined experience. Right-click any line to copy its text, copy a shareable link, or open it in the browser.

  • Run Attempts
    View all attempts for a run, making it simple to compare multiple executions and track changes over time.

Rerun Workflow Runs

Rerun all jobs or just the failed ones, with optional debug logging for deeper insights, so you can fix issues without starting a new run from scratch.

  • Rerun All Jobs
    Restart the entire workflow.

  • Rerun Failed Jobs
    Focus only on jobs that encountered errors, saving time and resources.

  • Enable Debug Logging
    Turn on debug logs before re-triggering for deeper insights into your workflow runs.

Manually Run Workflow

Trigger new runs for workflows that use the workflow_dispatch event trigger, complete with full support for all input parameter types, so you can customize and start jobs on-demand, right from your JetBrains IDE.

  • Trigger Any Dispatch-Ready Workflow
    Manually run any workflow that defines the workflow_dispatch event as a trigger.

  • Ref Picker
    Choose the branch or tag you want to run the workflow from.

  • Input Parameters
    Retrieve and populate all defined inputs for the selected ref, with full support for every parameter type and respect for default values set in your workflow file.

  • Input Validation
    Required parameters must have a value before the workflow can be triggered, ensuring no critical inputs are overlooked.

Assistance When Authoring Workflows

Author your GitHub Actions workflows faster and with fewer errors using intelligent autocomplete directly in your JetBrains IDE.

  • Environment Autocomplete
    Quickly insert GitHub Actions environments defined in your repository without needing to memorize or manually look them up.

  • Configuration Variables Autocomplete
    Easily select from repository level configuration variables with automatic suggestions as you type, ensuring accuracy and consistency. Autocomplete suggestions correctly reflect overrides by prioritizing environment level values first, followed by repository level values, and finally organization level values if no higher-priority override exists. Each suggestion clearly indicates its source (repository, organization, or environment), eliminating any ambiguity about the valueâ€™s origin.

  • Secrets Autocomplete
    Effortlessly include repository secrets with intelligent suggestions saving time and reducing manual errors. Autocomplete respects overrides across multiple definition levels, environment level definitions have the highest priority, followed by repository level, and lastly, organization level definitions. Each secret suggestion explicitly displays its source, ensuring you never have to guess where a secret is defined.

Overrides for secrets and configuration variables are automatically calculated based on your current job context. If the workflow job specifies an environment, Actionate dynamically applies environment level overrides, ensuring the most accurate and contextually relevant suggestions.

Autocomplete suggestions appear contextually as you edit your workflow files, streamlining your workflow creation and improving your overall productivity.

Multi-Account Support

Leveraging the JetBrains GitHub plugin for account management, you can seamlessly work with multiple GitHub accounts. Set a global default or assign a unique account to each project for maximum flexibility.

  • JetBrains GitHub Plugin Integration
    Account management is powered by the JetBrains GitHub plugin to seamlessly handle multiple GitHub accounts.

  • Project-Specific Account Assignment
    Assign a dedicated GitHub account to each project. Once set, your configuration is saved, so you only need to assign it once. You can update the assignment at any time by choosing a different active account in Actionate's settings.

data.name: Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons Lifetime
data.description:
Makes tool window and control icons colorful. This plugin is based on the ToolWindow Colorful Icons plugin and adds several new icons.
Three icon themes are available: Classic UI, New UI and New UI Remix.
You can also choose icons to (de)activate: see Settings > Appearance & Behavior > Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons.

License types:
- Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons offers monthly and yearly licenses. Freemium: if not using a license, you can still get colored icons when using the Classic UI.
- Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons Lifetime (new!) offers lifetime licenses: pay once, use it and get updates forever.

There are two different plugins because JetBrains does not allow plugin developers to offer all the license types (monthly/yearly and lifetime) for the same plugin. Both plugins offer the exact same features. The only difference is the license.

Check also my other plugins.

Documentation | Issues and Feature Requests
LinkedIn | Bluesky | ğŸ’™ Help Ukraine ğŸ’›

Suggested: Extra Tools Pack plugin.
The Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons plugin features are also available into the Extra Tools Pack plugin, which provides the exact same features as Extra ToolWindow Colorful Icons, Extra Icons and Extra IDE Tweaks, at a lower price.

data.description:
Provides support for the Jenkins linter

Features:

data.name: HTMX Pro (Lifetime)
data.description:
HTMX Pro plugin provides comprehensive support for the htmx library in JetBrains IDEs.

Features

  • Provides advanced coding assistance, including syntax highlighting, code completions, quick documentation, and inspections
  • Supports HTML and various templating languages, including JSX and TSX
  • Enables JavaScript language features with full type information in hx-on event handlers, hx-trigger event filters, and hx-vals, hx-request and hx-headers attributes
  • Enables CSS language features in selectors with support for the extended CSS selector syntax
  • Provides support for navigating and auto-completing endpoints within URLs
  • Provides support for HTMX extensions (enabled from Settings â†’ Languages & Frameworks â†’ HTMX)

Licenses

Due to marketplace limitations, different licensing options are offered as separate plugins:
  • HTMX Pro (Lifetime) offers perpetual licenses.
  • HTMX Pro offers monthly and yearly licenses.
Both plugins share the same functionality.

data.name: Yimi Gen Pro
data.description:
Yimi Gen is an IntelliJ IDEA plugin designed for quickly generating CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) code. It generates code based on Mybatis Model classes and supports the Spring + MybatisPlus + JPA technology stack. With built-in customizable templates, it adapts to various project needs.

Through a three-step process (functional design, file location, and code generation result), developers can effortlessly generate complex CRUD code, supporting multi-table join queries, nested queries.

Yimi Gen not only generates backend code but also supports full-stack code generation, including frontend admin pages, App pages, and mini-program pages.

Additionally, it offers real-time preview and incremental code comparison features, significantly boosting development efficiency, making it a powerful assistant for Java developers.

Features:
  • Visual Programming
  • Incremental Code Comparison
  • Customizable Templates (Velocity-based), placed in the templates directory at the workspace root
  • Supports Multi-table Join Queries
  • Supports Nested Queries
  • Supports Full-stack Code Generation (Backend, Frontend: Admin Pages, App Pages, Mini-program Pages)

data.name: AnNote
data.description:
AnNote is a code note plugin that supports multiple programming languages, code highlighting, code auto - completion, search functionality, attachment support, and Markdown file format. It can significantly improve developers' efficiency and experience during the code editing process. Whether it's recording daily code snippets or organizing important knowledge points, it can handle them with ease.
    This plugin supports many common programming languages such as Java, Python, and JavaScript, allowing developers to use a unified tool for note - taking in different projects. The code highlighting feature makes the code in the notes clearer and easier to read, enabling developers to quickly locate key code sections. Code auto - completion reduces the workload of manual input and speeds up code writing.
    The search function allows developers to quickly find the notes they need, even in a large number of notes. Attachment support enables developers to easily add files such as pictures and documents to the notes, enriching the content of the notes. Support for Markdown format files provides a simple yet powerful text editing method. Developers can use Markdown syntax to format their notes, making them more beautiful and professional.
    In addition, AnNote also provides an intuitive user interface and convenient operation methods, allowing developers to focus on the content of the notes rather than the use of the tool. Whether for individual developers or team collaboration, AnNote can be a useful assistant to help you better manage and record code - related information.

data.name: Russian Language Pack for IDEs & Plugins
data.description:
Russian Language Pack (One-time purchase â€“ lifetime license!) â€“ Ğ›Ğ¾ĞºĞ°Ğ»Ğ¸Ğ·Ğ°Ñ†Ğ¸Ñ Ğ½Ğ° Ñ€ÑƒÑÑĞºĞ¸Ğ¹ ÑĞ·Ñ‹Ğº. Ğ Ğ°Ğ·Ğ¾Ğ²Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ»Ğ°Ñ‚ĞµĞ¶ â€“ Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ¿Ğ¸ÑĞºĞ¸ Ğ¸ Ğ¾Ğ³Ñ€Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¸Ñ‡ĞµĞ½Ğ¸Ğ¹.

This plugin translates the interface of IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, WebStorm, PhpStorm, GoLand, DataGrip, Rider, CLion, RubyMine, RustRover, Android Studio, and other JetBrains IDEs into Russian â€” and also provides translations for many popular JetBrains plugins.

data.name: SystemVerilog Language Support
data.description:
Adds support for SystemVerilog (IEEE Std 1800-2017) language. The following features are available with IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition:
  • Syntax highlighting
  • Find definition and usages
  • Keywords completion
  • Structure view
  • File templates
  • Error annotation
  • Preprocessing (include/conditional/macro)
  • File formatting

Notes:

  • Please be noted that this plugin was intended to be a paid plugin.
  • Include directive supports absolute and relative header file path. If the header file path is a relative path, it is searched in the following order:
    1. directory of the current source file
    2. project root directory
    3. INCLUDE_PATH environment variable value configured in the current selected SystemVerilog RunConfiguration, which should be absolute paths separated with "::".

data.name: Cognitive Editor
data.description:
Focus and reduce redundancy: Freehand programming for Java and Kotlin.

The Cognitive Editor analyzes names to complete, repair and shorten code. It requires fewer interactions than built-in tools, so developers can further focus on the task at hand. Instead of LLMs, the plugin is based on an ongoing PhD project based on cognitive science research on reading and attention. It is offered as a free trial to fund the PhD project.

The plugin versions are early access: they are helpful for daily use, but I keep exploring new features, so implementation may be shallow, with edge cases more or less covered.

Main features

  • Extract local variables and functions on the fly
  • Rename local variables on click
  • Collapse redundancy in local variable declarations
  • Open function declarations in-place

See Settings > Cognitive

Documentation
Issues

data.name: Console Log Pro
data.description:
Smart Logging Assistant for Multiple Languages

Plugin Features

  • Multi-Language Support: Automatically generates appropriate log statements for:
    • JavaScript/TypeScript/JSX/TSX: console.log(`[filename] variable:`, variable);
    • Java: System.out.println("[filename] variable: " + variable);
    • Python: print(f'[filename] variable: {variable}')
    • Kotlin: println("[filename] variable: ${variable}")
    • Ruby: puts "[filename] variable: #{variable}"
    • PHP: echo "[filename] variable: " . variable;
  • Smart Context Awareness:
    • Includes filename in all log statements for easier debugging
    • Automatically includes selected variable in log statements when text is selected
    • Inserts log statements on a new line with proper indentation matching the code context
  • Log Management:
    • Delete all log statements in the current file with a single shortcut
    • Intelligently detects various log formats based on file type
    • Handles multi-line logs and template literals
    • Maintains clean code structure when removing logs

Free vs. Premium Features

Free Features Premium Features (Requires License)
  • Multi-language support (JS/TS, Java, Python, Kotlin, Ruby, PHP)
  • Basic log statement generation
  • Variable logging with automatic formatting
  • Context-aware indentation
  • Log cleanup functionality
  • Keyboard shortcuts
  • Editor context menu integration
  • Plugin configuration customization:
    • Toggle filename inclusion in log statements
    • Custom log prefix configuration
    • Custom log suffix configuration
    • Advanced settings UI

Keyboard Shortcuts

  • Insert Log Statement:
    • Mac: Cmd + L
    • Windows/Linux: Alt + L or Ctrl + L
  • Delete All Log Statements:
    • Mac: Cmd + Shift + L
    • Windows/Linux: Alt + Shift + L or Ctrl + Shift + L
  • Both actions are also available in the editor context menu
  • Shortcuts can be configured in Settings â†’ Keymap â†’ "Insert Log Statement" or "Delete All Log Statements"

Plugin Configuration

Premium features can be customized under Settings â†’ Tools â†’ Console Log Pro:

  • Toggle filename inclusion in log statements
  • Configure custom log prefix text
  • Configure custom log suffix text

Note: Plugin customization requires a license purchase

data.name: GitHub Actions Helper
data.description:
Plugin to help read and write GitHub action's workflow files.
Provide extra highlighting for:
* job's unique identifier, i.e. jobs.job_id
* needed jobs identifier in jobs.job_id.needs
* step's unique identifier in jobs.job_id.steps[*].id
* used actions name in jobs.job_id.steps[*].uses
* action's input parameters in jobs.job_id.steps[*].with
* common commands names in jobs.job_id.steps[*].run (disabled if Paid highlighting enabled)
* path or URL inside any key
* name for subflows, .i.e. name: key content (for jobs, steps, etc.)
* environment variables names, i.e. env: key content
* highlighting for Boolean constants (true, false) and Standalone number values (42)
* highlighting input variables, i.e. declared inside input:

Structure View with jobs:steps tree view

Paid subscription features inside jobs.job_id.steps[*].run:
* bash language support
* highlighting of user defined (echo "variable=...) Environment (>> $GITHUB_ENV) and Output (>> $GITHUB_OUTPUT) parameters
* highlighting of Variable references ($VARIABLE) and Parameter expansions (${VARIABLE:0:-4})
* highlighting of Default Environment variables (by GitHub): $GITHUB_ENV, CI, RUNNER_OS, etc.
* Regex language support inside with: regex-kind parameters
* Action files support: downloaded/cached and local (i.e. in .github/actions/)
* Declaration/Usage cross navigation for:
- output parameters, i.e. declared as echo "{name}={value}" >> "$GITHUB_OUTPUT"
- environment variables, i.e. declared as echo "{environment_variable_name}={value}" >> "$GITHUB_ENV"
* more to come, stay tuned!...

data.name: Django PowerTools
data.description:
IDE Plugin for Django projects

Django PowerTools adds a dedicated tool window that analyzes your Django project and presents a navigable structure of key components. It runs analysis in the background, caches results, and updates automatically on file changes.

Features

  • Django Project Structure Tool Window with comprehensive project visualization:
    • Models â€” classes, fields, and relationships with navigation to source
    • Admin â€” registered models and configurations
    • URLs â€” hierarchical structure of URL patterns
    • Templates â€” template hierarchy with inheritance and blocks
    • Forms â€” ModelForms and regular forms with their fields
    • Signals â€” project-defined signals with arguments and handlers
    • Settings â€” key project settings grouped by category; supports auto-detection and custom path
    • Migrations â€” migration history with dependencies
    • Static Files â€” static files structure grouped by path
    • Management Commands â€” custom commands with descriptions
  • Automatic background analysis with smart caching
  • Custom icons for Django-related folders
  • Quick navigation from the structure tree to source code

More info

  • meanmail.dev

Your ratings and feedback help prioritize features.

data.name: Dart Data Class Pro
data.description:
Generate boilerplate for your Dart data classes â€” now with inspections and Equatable support.

Features

Code generation

Dart Data Class plugin can generate the following code to make data class generation easy:

  • Named Argument Constructor
  • copyWith: copies the instance and overrides the given parameters
  • ==, hashCode, toString
  • all of the above with toString, equals (== operator), hashcode

Equatable support:

  • generate props getter

Inspections

In addition to code generation, this plugin also features inspections. Inspections make sure that all relevant properties are utilized in the data class methods, like in:

  • copyWith method
  • == method
  • hashCode method
  • Equatable props getter

Free vs Pro

For those using the existing free Dart Data Class plugin, below you can find the differences between the two:

FreePro
named argument constructor generationâœ…âœ…
copyWith generationâ˜‘ï¸ basicâœ… configurable
toString generationâ˜‘ï¸ basicâœ… configurable
== generationâ˜‘ï¸ basicâœ… configurable
hashCode generationâœ…âœ…
inspections with quick fixâŒâœ…
Equatable props supportâŒâœ…
toMap / fromMap generationâœ…âŒ
toJson / fromJson generationâŒâœ–ï¸ might be added later
bug fixesâŒâœ…

Some of these generations also cover more edge-cases in the Pro version of the Dart Data Class:

  • super call addition in hashCode and props
  • replacing of existing methods when regenerating
  • preview inspection update for some actions (like copyWith generation)
  • copyWith now supports nullable fields using a Function argument parameter
  • clean and straightforward configuration with preview to see immediately what the generated code will look like
  • faster code regeneration, because existing fields will be pre-selected in the member chooser dialog
  • bug fixes (like fields declared inside methods will not be taken into account for generation)
  • ... and many more

data.name: OpenAPI GUI Editor
data.description:
GUI Editor for OpenAPI specification (OAS) 3.0 and 3.1.

Why does the plugin exist?

While the OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) specification was initially designed to be human-editable, it has grown increasingly complex over time. Even with syntax highlighting and robust autocompletion tools, creating and maintaining OpenAPI documents remains challenging. The verbose format is easy to get lost in and requires familiarity with numerous technical details.

OpenAPI GUI Editor solves these problems by providing an intuitive visual interface that allows you to create and modify valid OpenAPI documents in seconds - no deep specification knowledge required.

Restrictions

  • The plugin currently supports the latest OpenAPI 3.0 and 3.1 standards, with support for earlier versions coming soon.
  • If your openapi.yml references multiple files, the plugin will only work with the main one.

Issues

If you have any problems or ideas of improvements, please feel free to create a new issue on Github or contact me personally on Telegram (@antonokolelov).

data.name: Code Portal
data.description:
Working with multiple editors? Code Portal is a plugin that allows you to open the current file in another editor and with just a command/shortcut/action. Support for VS Code, Cursor, Windsurf, and other VS Code fork.

Action Available

  • Code Portal: Open in VSCode - Open the current file in VSCode
  • Code Portal: Open in Cursor - Open the current file in Cursor
  • Code Portal: Open in Windsurf - Open the current file in Windsurf
    • You may need to manually specify the path to Windsurf in Preferences > Tools > Code Portal > Windsurf Executable Path
    • Example path on macOS: /Applications/Windsurf.app/Contents/Resources/app/bin/windsurf
  • Code Portal: Open in Another Editor - Open the the default editor

VS Code Features

Link: https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=jellynugget.code-portal-vscode

  • Supports text selection
  • Auto-toggles chat window when there is a selection
    • Opt out in settings
    • available after 0.0.4
  • Code Portal: Open in JetBrains IDE - Open the current file in JetBrains IDE
    • You can set your preferred JetBrains IDE in settings
    • available after 0.0.5
  • Code Portal: Open in Previous IDE - Open the current file back in the original JetBrains IDE
    • available after 0.0.5

data.name: Pine Script Support
data.description: Writing Pine-Script for TradingView becomes easy: Enhance your Pine Script development with powerful features: syntax highlighting, formatter, code inspections, and auto-completion. Boost your productivity and write cleaner, more efficient scripts with ease.

data.name: PanDev Jira Auto Worklog
data.description:
PanDev Jira Auto Worklog turns each Git commit into an accurate Jira work-log.
Branch name holds the issue key, the plugin measures edit time and posts it
to Jira automaticallyâ€”no timers, no manual entry.

data.name: StackTrace
data.description:
StackTrace is a one-click forensic snapshot for Python debugger sessions.

Whenever execution stopsâ€”on an exception, breakpoint, or your own hot-keyâ€”StackTrace collects:

  • Full call-stack with code â€“ function code, argument values and locals (frame limit configurable).
  • Console output â€“ last STDERR block plus any warnings in flight.
  • Thread table â€“ PID / TID, running / paused state, current thread highlighted.
  • Environment & interpreter details â€“ OS, CPU/heap, IDE build, JRE, Python path & version, venv/Conda info.
  • Package inventory â€“ either the full pip list or only packages imported in the stack (toggle).
  • Called-function source â€“ project or external-library callees, depth-limited and optionally expanded to their full files.
  • Full-file dump â€“ automatically attach the complete source file for the last N frames.

The report is emitted as clean Markdown or plain text format and copied straight to your clipboardâ€”ready for a ticket, code-review comment, or AI prompt. All heavy work runs on background threads, no IDE restart is ever required, and nothing leaves your machine.

Why seasoned developers use it

  • Zero ceremony â€“ auto-fires on every pause or via Tools â–º Run StackTrace Now.
  • AI-ready â€“ per-project Global, Error, and Debug prompts injected ahead of the trace.
  • Noise dial â€“ sliders for frame count, recursion depth, path verbosity, package scope, thread info, and full-file attachments.
  • Zero-restart install â€“ hot-loads instantly from the Marketplace.
  • Works offline â€“ 100 % local processing; no telemetry.

Target IDEs: PyCharm 2024.1 + (Community & Professional) and IntelliJ IDEA / DataGrip / CLion with the Python plugin.

Full documentation: mixelll.github.io/StackTracePublic/Documentation.html

data.name: YmlHelper
data.description:
What Problem Does This Solve?

Since a key in a YAML file can be nested across multiple levels, finding and locating a specific key becomes very cumbersome. This is especially true when dealing with long YAML files or when the target key is deeply nested and similar levels exist multiple times throughout the file. Searching and pinpointing the key can consume significant time and effort, often accompanied by a psychological burden of potentially selecting the wrong one. This plugin aims to address these pain points associated with YAML operations by offering numerous convenient and efficient features.

Features Provided by This Plugin

1. Quick Search Within a Single File

Invoke the search box using Ctrl+Alt+F, enter the full path of the key (key) you want to find, then click search or press Enter. This will jump to the corresponding key and highlight it.

Example:

Press Ctrl+Alt+Fto invoke the search box, enter: `server.port`, then press Enter to jump to and locate the following content in the YAML file:

server:
  port: 8080

2. Global Search Across the Project

When multiple YAML files exist in a project, invoke the global search box using Ctrl+Shift+Alt+F. Enter the full path of the key (key) you want to search for (e.g., `server.port`), then click search or press Enter. The global search results will be displayed below the search box.

Select a file from the search results; the keys (keys) matching your query within that file will be displayed on its right side and highlighted. Right-click on a file in the search results to jump to and open the corresponding YAML file in the editor window.

3. Conversion of properties-type key-value pairs to yml

It supports copying configurations from a properties file, pasting them into a yml file, then selecting the pasted content, right-clicking, and clicking 'Convert to YAML Format' to convert them into the yml file format.

Example: Select server.port=8080, right-click, and click 'Convert to YAML Format'

It can be converted to the configuration in the following format: server: port: 8080

Features Continuously Updating......

Fuzzy Search Quick Merge of Duplicate Keys Quick Generation of Java Configuration Classes

data.name: Kubernetes Control Center
data.description:
Kubernetes Control Center

Your complete Kubernetes management solution, seamlessly integrated with your JetBrains IDE.

Kubernetes Control Center provides a powerful interface to explore, monitor, and interact with your Kubernetes resources directly within your development environment. Streamline your workflow and boost productivity by eliminating the need to switch between terminal windows or browser dashboards.

Key Features:

  • Resource Explorer: Navigate and manage all cluster resources in an intuitive hierarchical view
  • Live Logs: Stream, search, and analyze container logs in real time with advanced filtering
  • Interactive Terminal: Open shell sessions inside containers for direct troubleshooting and commands
  • Port Forwarding: Easily forward ports from pods and services to your local machine for testing
  • YAML Editor: View, validate, and modify resource definitions with syntax highlighting
  • Multi-cluster Management: Seamlessly switch between contexts, namespaces, and clusters
  • Resource Details: Inspect comprehensive information about each Kubernetes resource
  • Helm Integration: Manage and monitor Helm releases directly from your IDE
  • ArgoCD Support: View and manage ArgoCD applications within the same interface
  • Custom Resources: Full support for Custom Resource Definitions (CRDs) and Custom Resources
  • Namespace Management: Create and manage namespaces directly from the UI
  • Events Viewer: Monitor Kubernetes events for troubleshooting and diagnostics
  • Nginx Ingress Controller Integration: Automatically detects Nginx Ingress Controller and exposes an nginx.conf
  • Resource Operations: Delete, refresh, and manage resources with contextual actions

Supported Resources:

  • Workloads: Pods, Deployments, StatefulSets, DaemonSets, Jobs, CronJobs, ReplicaSets, ReplicationControllers
  • Services & Networking: Services, Ingresses, IngressClasses, NetworkPolicies, Endpoints
  • Config & Storage: ConfigMaps, Secrets, PersistentVolumes, PersistentVolumeClaims, StorageClasses
  • RBAC: ServiceAccounts, Roles, RoleBindings, ClusterRoles, ClusterRoleBindings
  • Cluster: Namespaces, Nodes, ResourceQuotas, LimitRanges
  • Autoscaling: HorizontalPodAutoscalers, PodDisruptionBudgets
  • Other Resources: PriorityClasses, RuntimeClasses, Leases, MutatingWebhookConfigurations, ValidatingWebhookConfigurations

Benefits:

  • Accelerate debugging with integrated logs and terminal access
  • Gain comprehensive visibility into your cluster's state and structure
  • Enhance productivity by managing Kubernetes without leaving your IDE
  • Simplify complex Kubernetes operations with an intuitive interface

This plugin is actively maintained and regularly updated with new features and improvements based on user feedback. We're committed to building the ultimate Kubernetes experience for JetBrains IDE users.

Have questions, feature requests, or found a bug? We value your input â€” your feedback directly influences our development roadmap.

kubernetes, k8s, container, docker, devops, cloud, helm, argocd, cluster, pod, deployment, service, namespace, kubectl, microservices, orchestration, containerization

For more information, visit the plugin website. If you need help or have questions, check the support page.

Manual Mode:
Perfect for quick file organization and copy-paste workflows. Keep your important files organized in a dedicated tool window for easy access and manual sharing with AI assistants.

Auto-Sync Mode:
Automatic synchronization to Claude projects. Files are instantly uploaded when added and automatically updated when changed.
Requires the companion Firefox extension "Project Files Manager Companion".

  1. Right-click any file â†’ "Add to Project Files" (or Ctrl+Alt+1)

  4. Auto-sync mode: Files automatically sync to your Claude project

It supports mainstream programming languages such as Java, Python, and JavaScript, serving as a lightweight solution for teams to protect their intellectual property rights.

data.name: AEM Repository Tools
data.description:
AEM Repository Tools - ART

ART plugin works with one plugin without installing external tools and quickly manages JCR content. This tool is more useful in environments with many developers and many servers.

Put With..: Transfers content to multiple selected servers.

Put: Transfers content selected in the Project file tree or Editor to the server.

Get: Retrieves from the server to the location selected in the Project file tree or Editor (overwrite).

Diff: Compares the selected file (single) with the server.

data.name: Extra IDE Tweaks Lifetime
data.description:
Some utilities for IDE maintenance and tweaking, plus workarounds for a few IDE issues. See Tools > Extra IDE Tweaks.

License types:
- Extra IDE Tweaks offers monthly and yearly licenses.
- Extra IDE Tweaks Lifetime (new!) offers lifetime licenses: pay once, use it and get updates forever.

There are two different plugins because JetBrains does not allow plugin developers to offer all the license types (monthly/yearly and lifetime) for the same plugin. Both plugins offer the exact same features. The only difference is the license.

Features:
  • The Open Editors tool window shows opened files in all editors belonging to the opened project, as in VSCode. It can also display a list of recently opened files, as in the Recent Files action.
  • Can make folder icons more visible (with no outline style) when using the New UI. You can also use it with the regular UI.
  • Can change most tool windows label. Per example, rename the "Pull Requests" tool window to "PR".
  • Can confirm the opening of sensitive files. May be useful when streaming and/or accidentally opening a sensitive file in situations where you can leak critical information.
  • Can open projects located in trusted locations directly via File > Trusted Locations, just after Recent Projects.
  • Can register your favorite projects, organize them with optional groups, and gain fast access to your favorite projects via File > Favorite Projects, just after Recent Projects and Trusted Locations.
  • Can define default Excluded Folders (not per-project). There is now a global list of excluded folders. Go to Extra IDE Tweaks settings for details.
  • Commit Alert: this inspection allows you to define keywords that will show a confirmation dialog before committing files containing any of those keywords. Per example, define the COMMIT_ALERT keyword, modify, delete or move one or multiple files containing it, then commit. A confirmation dialog will appear asking if you still want to commit.
  • Activate All Tool Windows: this action activates all available tool windows in the current project. Enable it in settings, then see the "Window > Activate All Tool Windows" menu item. It's like clicking on the "..." button on the left-side toolbar, then clicking on each available tool window.
  • Can register any program and add it to the "Open In" list when doing a right-click on a file, a folder, or a project. Your program will be added next to the "Open In" Terminal action. That means you can open files and folders with your favorite program (like ForkLift, Total Commander, Vim...). You can register up to 2 "Open In" actions. Go to Extra IDE Tweaks settings for details.
    You can also open files with Associated Application. This additional action is enabled for IDEs prior to 2024 only, as it is already implemented by 2024+ IDEs.
  • Can open a folder as a Project via the "Open In" menu.
  • Can rename tab names to remove the parenthesis after the file names if they're located in the root project or module. Per example, renames "build.gradle.kts (my-module)" to "build.gradle.kts". For now, it works with "build.gradle", "build.gradle.kts", "build.gradle.dcl", "settings.gradle", "settings.gradle.kts" "settings.gradle.dcl" and "src/main/resources/META-INF/plugin.xml" files only.
  • Can purge IDE's plugin download cache, or its image cache only. This is a workaround for known IDE limitation ğŸ› IJPL-6179.
  • Can schedule the IDE's GC.
  • Can schedule the GC on local JVMs. May be useful when having multiple Gradle or Kotlin Compiler daemons consuming too much memory. You can choose to run the GC on selected JVMs: all local JVMs, or by filtering by JVM instance name with your own regexes.
  • Adds a Properties action to the File and Folder context menu that shows information like size, number of files, etc.
  • Adds a menu item under Tools in order to access the Plugins Manager faster.
  • Offers a workaround for known IDE issue ğŸ› IDEA-341174: the Git tool window may display the wrong label "Version Control" instead of "Git".
Extra IDE Tweaks Chinese UI is automatically applied if you enable the official IDE Chinese Language Pack plugin. For 2024.2+ IDEs, you need to select the Chinese locale in File > Appearance & Behavior > System Settings > Language and Region.

data.name: Bootstrap Fold
data.description:
Bootstrap Fold

We all love Bootstrap CSS, but sometimes it can be a bit verbose. This plugin will help you fold the classes to make your templates more readable. Enable Bootstrap Fold plugin and enjoy the clean code and better readability. If you are annoyed by other html attributes or your custom ones then you can customize them in plugin settings.

The plugin will allow you to fold class attributes in HTML, Vue templates, Svelte templates and JavaScript/TypeScript files that create templates.

Supported filetypes:

  • HTML
  • Vue HTML templates
  • Svelte HTML templates
  • React JSX templates
  • HTML templates inside JavaScript/TypeScript
  • Astro HTML templates

Plans:

Free

Freemium

Class attribute collapsing

Can customize any attributes

Can collapse/expand all tags globally

Can collapse/expand all tags globally

X

Can collapse customized attributes in all tags in file/p>

X

Can expand customized attributes in all tags in file/p>

Useful shortcuts:

  1. Expand/Collapse All attributes use shortcut (Shift + cmd + P on Mac or Shift + Ctrl + P on Windows). This is going to change global setting. If you had previously opened files their expand/collapse state will change after you navigate to the file and start making some changes. IDE doesn't force file rerendering before your action.
  2. To expand/collapse "class" attribute under cursor use default IDE code folding shortcut (Cmd + dot on Mac or Ctrl + . on Windows). If your cursor is between attribute value start and end then using shortcut will collapse attribute value.
  3. You can open collapsed area by clicking on collapsed attribute value placeholder. In default configuration clicking on "..." will open its value.

Paid version shortcuts:

  1. Fold All Attributes shortcut (Shift + cmd + F on Mac or Shift + Ctrl + F on Windows) - fold all attributes in active file
  2. Expand All Attributes shortcut (Shift + cmd + C on Mac or Shift + Ctrl + C on Windows) - fold all attributes in active file

Feel free to remap shortcuts in IDE settings -> keymap -> "shortcut name"

Support Plugin Developer:

If you like the plugin, and you are using free version of that, please consider supporting Me or subscribing for the plugin.

Support my work

NetLinx Tools

NetLinx Tools is a JetBrains IDE plugin for AMX NetLinx developers that makes working with NetLinx code faster and more convenient.

  • Syntax highlighting for core NetLinx constructs (AXS, AXI).
  • Code folding and visual project structure.

The plugin is continuously evolving: new autocomplete features, code inspections, and improvements to the project structure interface will be added regularly.

data.name: System Notifier
data.description:
Add native system notifications to the IDE

What does this plugin do?

It turns important IDE events into native operating system notifications. This way, you can follow the status of your tasks without keeping the IDE in the foreground.


Key features:
  • Shows external system tasks (Gradle, Maven, ...) as system notifications when they finish.
  • Notifies when Run/Debug configurations start and finish.
  • Optional: mirror all IDE notifications as system notifications.
  • Option to add sound to notifications.
  • OS compatibility:
    • Windows: Action Center (tray).
    • macOS: Notification Center.
    • Linux: libnotify; with an in-IDE fallback when there is no D-Bus session.
  • Easy configuration under Settings/Preferences â†’ Tools â†’ System Notifier.

Notes
  • It does not collect or send personal data.
  • On Linux a D-Bus session is required for native notifications; otherwise, an in-IDE balloon is used.

data.name: Logger Auto Folding
data.description:
This plugin lets you stay focused on business logic instead of getting distracted by logs.
This plugin will automatically fold calls to LoggerInterface methods, allowing you to hide log statements in your code without interrupting with log call.
It automatically detects \Psr\Log\LoggerInterface and any class that implements it, making it fully compatible with Monolog, the Laravel Log facade, and any other PSR-compliant logger.
You can quickly toggle auto-folding with Ctrl+Alt+Shift+F (Cmd+Alt+Shift+F on Mac), and customize which methods should be folded right in the settings.
Keep your code clean, stay productive, and spend your time on what really matters.
